Title: Project Engineer
job description:
We are seeking a Project Engineer for a full-time opportunity in Oxford.

Starting Salary - $68-73K/yr plus bonuses

Job Summary:
The Project Engineer handles all aspects of design, development and project management for a diverse line of mechanical components and products. This includes customer and supplier interface, competitive product analysis, test definition, data analysis, prototype development, product validation, program leadership and manufacturing development. The Project Engineer will own every aspect of their project and product line from opportunity identification through the entire lifecycle. This position requires constant interfacing with all aspect of the organization including Sales, Operations, Quality and Procurement. This position requires a combination of Design Engineering and Project management skills.

Essential Functions:
1) Leads projects from Design and Development to Manufacturing Release by creation of project plans and timelines, communicating progress of project, overcoming roadblocks, and design validation testing.
2) Work along side Manufacturing and Quality in the project design phase and during handoff to ensure a smooth transition.
3) Work along side Manufacturing and Quality to improve product design and/or process improvements.
4) Manage Engineering Change Requests within assigned product lines.
5) Be the Technical Expert in assigned product lines.
6) Regularly interface with sales to identify new opportunities and keep updated on current projects. Attend trade shows when appropriate; keep up to date with industry trends.
7) Use a scientific approach to problem solving including design analysis, engineering calculations and statistics.
8) Researches and analyze design proposals and other data to evaluate the feasibility, cost, and assembly requirements of designs or applications.
9) Specifies system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications
10) Prepares product reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
11) Investigates and resolves product issues. Determines non-conforming modes and issues corrective action reports to resolve them.
12) Communicates effectively with internal and external customers and responds promptly to their inquiries.
13) Meets internal and external customers deadlines as scheduled

Additional Responsibilities:
1) Performs other duties as assigned

Qualifications:
1) Bachelor degree in Mechanical Engineering with a minimum of 5 years’ experience.
2) Experience in New Product Development with a History of managing successful product launches on time and within budget.
3) Experience reading and interpreting standards such as ASME, ASTM, ISO, SAE etc.
4) Strong work ethic, ability to work independently, as a team member and a team leader
5) Highly motivated, self-starter
6) Excellent writing, presentation, communication and organizational skills
7) The ability to work under pressure
8) The ability to prioritize and plan effectively
9) Good problem-solving skills and a creative approach for new ideas
10) A high level of computer literacy, particularly computer-aided design
11) Solidworks proficiency a Plus
12) PMP certification a plus.
13) 6 Sigma Black or Green belt a plus.

Who are we?
Our Company, S.S. White Technologies Inc., is an internationally renowned manufacturer of aerospace, automotive and orthopedic surgical tools. Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Description:
The Mechanical Engineer – Intermediate will be responsible for the design, development and release efforts for automotive components from inception to production. The Mechanical Engineer – Intermediate will be involved with current production components in addition to future development programs. Responsibilities will include, but not limited to:
Design vehicle components from concept and prototype build levels to production, including characteristics from Lessons Learned in other programs and the COE engineering requirements.
Develop statement of work/source package for the component supplier.
Assess component suppliers to determine their technical competence to manufacture the component.
Develop DFMEA’s to identify potential failure modes and DVP&Rs to ensure that functional objectives are met by the component design and validation is completed.
Design the component for manufacturability and assembly, as well as work with other Product Engineers with interfacing components and systems.
Participate in post-test reviews including failure analysis, and work closely with suppliers and manufacturing plants to ensure that design changes are robust and feasible for manufacturing.
Lead global cross functional teams to develop parts which meet all regions requirements.
Define “No Touch” zones on the components during assembly.
Critique the manufacturing equipment and functions on the supplier floor with Supplier Quality engineer.
Assess near production level parts, material dunnage and line delivery plans with the global teams, including the suppliers.
Track warranty items, work with supplier quality personnel to address manufacturing and quality concerns.
Deliver all functional and manufacturing aspects for the component.
Requirements:
BS degree in Mechanical Engineering from an ABET accredited university
3-5 years plus related experience with mechanical engineering component design
Good communication, presentation and technical report writing skills (comfortable interfacing with business partners of all levels).
Engineer must be experienced with basic PC software (e.g. MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Project)
Good teamwork skills, ability to work independently and to manage suppliers
Knowledge of releasing process, DFMEA’s, DVP’s and root cause analysis methodologies.
Preferred Requirements:
MBA or Master of Science in Applied Physics, Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, Industrial, or Computer Engineering, or related Engineering field from an ABET accredited university
Passion for, interest in and hands on working knowledge of cars
Experience releasing components at an OEM or large Tier 1 company.
Demonstrated experience in supplier management.
**Positions will start with training on 1st or 2nd shift and will move to 3rd shift permanently beginning in March/April 2021**

Pay: $35.00 - $40.00 per hour
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Location:
One location

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
In this role you will use engineering methodologies to design, optimize, and validate mechanical and electromechanical systems for use in medical instrumentation and related equipment. Responsibilities include research, prototyping, development, validation, transfer to manufacturing and product support. The engineer will need to ensure compliance with specifications, codes and customer requirements.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities
Provide reliable, timely, and cost-effective solutions to a variety of problems using sound problem solving techniques, engineering tools and creativity
Make estimates on tooling, part cost and design time for new parts
Initiate purchase requisitions, build, fabricate and assemble prototype electromechanical components, sub-assemblies and instruments for physical testing
Create models and drawings for new parts
Experience in SolidWorks
Write or execute test plans to validate parts and/or systems
Write or update standard operating procedures, manuals, and presentations for new and existing products.
Educational and Skill Set Requirements
Bachelor of Science or Master of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field
Ability to organize and coordinate multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing tasks as needed
Initiative to start and complete tasks independently and within a team
Advanced working knowledge of CAD and Microsoft Office software: Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Experience with SolidWorks

Title: Senior Engineer - Suspension Design
job description:
Position: Senior Engineer – Suspension Design
The Company:
Faraday Future (FF) is a California-based mobility company, leveraging the latest technologies and world’s best talent to realize exciting new possibilities in mobility. We’re producing user-centric, technology-first vehicles to establish new paradigms in human-vehicle interaction. We’re not just seeking to change how our cars work – we’re seeking to change the way we drive. At FF, we’re creating something new, something connected, and something with a true global impact.
Your Role:
As a Senior Engineer on the Chassis team, you’ll be working with some of the industry’s brightest minds to create, develop, refine, and launch world class suspension systems on world class vehicles for the modern age. Basically, you’ll be a major contributor within the team that ensures Faraday’s cars ride, handle and perform as well as they look.
Responsibilities:
Facilitate extended handover to full time replacement for all component group responsibilities
Design of new parts and systems from concept level through to production release.
Redesign existing parts for improved performance, quality and manufacturability.
Generate new shock absorber/suspension concepts to advance technology portfolio.
Participate/lead creative brainstorming sessions to solve technical challenges.
Analyze quality issues for failure root causes and implement corrective actions.
Analyze lab and field test results to determine best path forward.
Perform advanced engineering calculations and analysis.
Create 3d models, 2d prints and FEA reports in CAD utilizing design standards, best practices & GD&T
Basic Qualifications:
BS in Mechanical Engineering or related study.
5+ years of experience in engineering of lightweight, metallic structures
Well versed in chassis architecture strategies and global regulations (e.g. FMVSS, GB)
Top-notch skills with CATIA V5+, GD&T, and component and system DVP&R
Strong familiarity with linear finite element analysis tools including hand calculations
Preferred Qualifications:
Proven expertise with compressed timeline launches and design for mass production followed through from concept to serial production launch.
A diverse skillset including familiarity with structural component design as well as complex assembly designs including steel, aluminum, plastic, composites and hybrid constructions.
A wide range of experience with simulation software including, ANSYS, Nastran, HyperWorks/ Optistruct
Proficiency in crash and/or dynamic road loads analysis (e.g. ADAMS, Motionsolve)
A creative curiosity, collaborative ethic, hardworking enthusiasm, and a driving personal vision
Excellent communication skills and team-working tendencies
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $115,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance

We follow strict CDC, State and County guidelines to ensure the healthy & safety of all our employees. We temperature check upon arrival, masks are required throughout the facilities, we have hand sanitizing stations and provide protective eye wear.

engineering lightweight, metallic structures: 5 years (Preferred)

Title: Electro-Mechanical Support Engineer
job description:
Electro-Mechanical Support Engineer
You’ve been pursuing a career in Engineering to leverage your years of education and hard work. You aspire to put all that you have learned and accomplished to work and leverage it to solve complex and real world challenges - you simply can’t get engineering out of your blood. You maintain tireless curiosity on the inner workings of electro-mechanical assemblies and the desire to figure out how they work. You love rolling up your sleeves and solving problems – this is the satisfaction that fulfills you!
The time has come to make your move. You’re looking to join a respected and well- established organization that’s going to elevate your professional career and help you achieve your goals. Best of all, with an organization that is presented with vast new business opportunity and tremendous upside potential. We’re only on this Earth once so why work for an employer that doesn’t value your contributions or is limiting your full potential.
If you want to make an impact and push your engineering talents to another level while helping an organization achieve its ambitious growth plans – we want to talk to you!
Why is Global Interconnect, Inc. (GII) interested in hiring a Electro-Mechanical Support Engineer?
GII has ambitious growth goals and is committed to doubling the size of the organization in the next 5 years. The opportunity is extremely ripe for the right candidate to be a key contributor to this growth.
With a robust product development and engineering process, Global Interconnect needs to add another engineer to its Team.
About GII
Global Interconnect, Inc. is a design, engineering, and manufacturing firm with headquarters in the US and offices in Hong Kong and China. Our niche and primary focus is providing custom connectors, cable assemblies, and sub-assemblies of unparalleled quality for medical device and high-end industrial
OEM’s. These end devices and instruments are used around the world impacting, improving and in many cases saving lives each and every day. (Check us out at https://www.globalinterconnect.com)
Job summary
As a key member of the Engineering Team this individual will have the following main responsibilities
1. Provide engineering support to sustaining and mature product lines in the way of engineering change orders, drawing/specification development and/or maintenance
2. Lead manufacturing and quality engineering efforts in troubleshooting and failure analysis of defective/rejected product as well as provide disposition support while working with multiple cross functional teams (e.g., Quality, Program Management, Outside Sales, etc.)
3. Participate in meetings with customers to provide engineering input, findings, solutions and support in conjunction with members of other cross functional teams
4. Work with multiple cross functional teams (Quality, Program Managers, Manufacturing, etc.) to create First Article reports, Qualification and Test Plans, and other related customer deliverables
5. Provide support and engineering input to Corrective Action Reports/Requests (CARs) and Supplier
Corrective Action Reports/Requests (SCARs)
6. Assist in the development and management of product cost reduction proposals and strategies
7. Provide engineering and technical input on an ad hoc basis to new product development and launch activities
Requirements and skills
Honest and genuine
Ability to establish relationships
Available for full-time employment
1-3 year engineering experience
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar
Outstanding communication skills; phone and email is crucial
The ability to handle pressure and meet deadlines
Excellent time management and organization skills
Creative talents and the ability to solve tough problems
Attention to detail
Team player but capable of being independent
Basic knowledge of the product design process from inception through manufacturing
3D Cad experience. Preferred SolidWorks
2D Cad experience a plus but not necessarily a requirement
Understanding of plastic insulator materials as well as electrical wire insulating jacket materials including electrical and mechanical properties
Basic background in the following
Electro-mechanical engineering
Creating and modifying engineering drawings/specifications
Technical report writing and data formatting
Metrology (mechanical and electrical measurements)
Root cause analysis
Engineering statistics (minitab)
If interested in exploring this exciting opportunity, we are eager to speak with you!

Title: Administrative Specialist (Mechanical and Material Engineering)
job description:
Under minimal supervision this position is responsible for the coordination and management of administrative activities for a research project. Exercises considerable discretion and independent judgement to interpret policy and procedures and to answer complex questions. Requires thorough knowlege of office practices and procedures in order to perform complex administrative support duties, assists the Principal Investigator and co-investigator.
Oversees and facilitates specific project activities including but not limited to coordination of research meetings, lab purchases, prepare monthly research and budget reports, and assist in any administrative related activities.
Serves as University Credit card holder for School transactions. Adheres to University credit card policies and procedures. Maintains record of requisitions, and credit card transactions in the format established by the Budget Manager. Provides details on transactions as needed for account reconciliation, budgeting and reporting purposes. Interprets, monitors, and analyzes information regarding policies and procedures.
Assist Principal Investigator and researchers with required Travel arrangements following FIU policies.
Prepares presentation materials for use by the Principal Investigator, senior researchers and other faculty working on the project, editing content and adding appropriate graphic and design elements.
Composes and/or prepares correspondence, memoranda, promotional materials, forms, meeting minutes, and reports using appropriate word processing and spreadsheet tools.
Maintains and monitors project's budget and financial data following the projects spending plan. Provide monthly updated expenditures to the Principal Investigator.
Performs basic statistical calculations on data for monthly reports and presentations.
Plans and arranges special events and related research activities for the project.
Coordinates and track activities related to project work such as required trainings for project participants.
Networks to build campus relationships to expedite work, projects and administrative duties.
Serves as primary contact and/or resource to outside parties, such as vendors, government agencies, and other Universities research partners.
Initiates and coordinates all personnel and procurement transactions for the research project.
Works directly with Project's Principal Investigator to perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.
Performs related duties as required or as directed. The omission of specific duties does not preclude the supervisor from assigning duties that are logically related to the position.
Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or GED and six (6) years of office or related experience coordinating functions of an office or department.
Job Category
Administrative
Advertised Salary
$37,000-$42,000

Work Schedule

Begin time: 8:30 AM
End time: 5:00 PM
Pre-Employment Requirements
Criminal Background Check
Fingerprinting Check
Other Information
This is a time limited appointment which may be terminated at anytime with 30 days' notice
How To Apply

Prospective Employee
If you have not created a registered account, you will be asked to create a username and password for use of the system. It is recommended that you provide an active/valid e-mail account as that will be the main source of communication regarding your status within the process. In this account, you are able to track your applicant status in "My Applications".
In order to be considered eligible for the position as an internal candidate, departmental staff must meet minimum requirements of the position, be in good performance standing, and have been continuously employed at the University for at least six months.
Before you begin the process, we recommend that you are prepared to attach electronic copies of your resume, cover letter or any other documents within the application process. It is recommended that you combine your cover letter and resume/curriculum vitae into one attachment. Attached documents should be in Microsoft Word or PDF format. All applicants are required to complete the online application including work history and educational details (if applicable), even when attaching a resume.
This posting will close at 12:00 am of the close date.

Title: Quality Engineer
job description:
Ortho Development is a fast growing company nestled at the foot of the Wasatch Mountains. We offer competitive compensation and excellent benefits. Ortho has been designing and manufacturing orthopedic implants since 1994. Our main products include total hip arthroplasty, total knee arthroplasty, spine implants, and trauma plates and screws. We are an exciting place to work that provides autonomy for you to excel at your tasks.
As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible to design and implement methods and controls for inspection, testing, validating, and otherwise evaluate the precision and accuracy of products, processes, and production equipment.
Principal Responsibilities:
MRB Processes
Develop and Perform IQ/OQ/PQ on manufacturing processes and test equipment
Review / Approval of Ortho Development Corporation specifications for completeness, including inspect-ability and correct dimensioning
Review / Approval of other Ortho Development Corporation process- and product-related documents, including the IQ/OQ/PQs, to ensure accuracy, regulatory compliance, and system/process/equipment integrity
Project management and quality representative on multiple design- and process- related project teams
Experience implementing and maintaining CAPA process.
Post market surveillance including complaint review.
Participation in MRB (non-conforming product) dispositions.
Problem solving; root cause analysis for systems/processes/equipment
Development of inspection techniques, including dedicated attribute gauging
Creation and approval of Test and Inspection Procedures (Control Plans)
Supplier qualification including audits and validation of critical supplier processes
Liaison with suppliers regarding inspection methods and product quality issues
Assist Q.C. regarding inspection methods and issues
Creation (system development and technical writing) and implementation (including training) of quality system documents for the following: Supplier Qualification; Inspection Methods and Gaging, Control Plans; and Calibration Procedures
QA/RA compliance representative on multiple process, design, and improvement project teams covering the items listed above
Comply with and report on all city, state, Federal and International regulations.
Comply with all company safety and health policies and procedures.
Comply with all company policies and procedures.
Lead the development and implementation of systems, processes or equipment to ensure the Quality System at Ortho is current and state-of-the-art.
Participation in risk management activities
Requirements:
CQA, CQE, Green Belt, Black Belt certification/training preferred
Thorough understanding of scientific methods
Ability to perform statistical analysis using statistical techniques
Ability to interpret blueprints
Good communication skills
Knowledgeable with computers: word processor, spreadsheet and database programs
Must be a self-starter with minimal supervision and an ability to do strategic planning
Sampling plan (attribute and variable)
Knowledge of Design of Experiments (DOE)
DMAIC
FMEA
ISO 13485:2016 (QMS)
21CFR820 (QSR)
Must be familiar with GD&T

Title: Contract Mechanical Designer
job description:
This is a 6-month contract opportunity with work being performed onsite at our facility in Northboro, MA
Saint-Gobain’s North American R&D center is looking for driven, talented, and energetic contact mechanical engineer to join our current team in conducting hands-on prototyping and laboratory experiments for key development programs. Projects will focus on process and product development activities related to CertainTeed’s extensive product line.
Under the direction of the group leader, the Mechanical Engineer will work closely with the team to assist in all aspects of the design and engineering process including conceptualizing, digital modeling, prototyping, analysis (physical and simulation), presenting to customers and colleagues, researching manufacturing techniques, go-to-market implementation, and manufacturing support. In addition to the candidate’s primary projects, the candidate will be expected to support projects led by others.
Early career mechanical engineer with expertise in CAD, prototyping, programming & testing
Utilizes standard machine shop tools, 3D printing, specialized equipment & external vendors to develop prototypes & test fixtures
Exhibits creativity in selecting approaches and techniques for obtaining solutions.
Has a bias for action and agile methods, is unafraid to try things as a way of learning.
Utilizes basic scientific or engineering principles and techniques to undertake specific tasks and projects with limited scope
Troubleshoots and resolves problems in the design/execution of development projects
Supports senior engineers and scientists in R&D team with their projects
Executes and/or supports commercial and manufacturing support requests
Manages and documents projects and tasks effectively with supervision
Presents data internally and contributes to external publications when appropriate
Seeks out others to enhance and streamline development and decision making
Competencies/Requirements
Experience with CAD, programming & fabrication
Comfort with basic machine shop equipment & techniques
Demonstrated ability to identify and solve problems of moderate scope
Project management skills, team collaboration, and oral and written communication skills
Must possess a body of technical work commensurate with their years of experience including but not limited to: demonstration of engineering design and analysis, hands-on prototyping, fixture, and test setup design, and drawing conclusions based on a collection of basic data and interpretation
Demonstrated adequate knowledge in HSE
Ability to communicate within and outside of the group
BS Degree in Mechanical Engineering
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $28.00 - $35.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Contract Length:
5 - 6 months
Full Time Opportunity:
No
Work Remotely:
No

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
job description:
We have a Full-Time Direct Hire opportunity with a Manufacturing company in the Kansas City, MO area.
The Manufacturing Engineer will be responsible for transferring new and revised products to manufacturing, supporting new and existing products, and working with other departments to solve manufacturing related problems. Products will include mechanical and electromechanical parts, assemblies, or systems used in medical instrumentation. The engineer will need to ensure compliance with specifications, codes and customer requirements.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities
Coordinates the manufacturing launch of new or revised parts, assemblies, or systems used in medical instrumentation
Creates or revises standard operating procedures, manuals, spec sheets, and drawings related to new or revised parts, assemblies, or systems
Communicates effectively with other engineers, other departments and vendors
Seeks to find ways to improve quality, training, safety, and cost
Investigates and seeks to eliminate causes of non-conformance
Assists with instrument sustainment and maintenance programs
Provides exemplary personal integrity and work ethic
Understands and adheres to GMP, ISO and other quality system procedures
Educational and Skill Set Requirements
Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineering, or higher
3 or more years experience in a manufacturing environment
Experience with machining, bending, punching, cutting, injection molding
Experience with 3D models and drawings – experience in SolidWorks a plus
Initiative to start and complete tasks independently or within a team.

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Title: General Engineer
job description:
Duties
Summary
*****THESE POSITIONS ARE LOCATED WITHIN ENGINEERING SERVICE. THERE ARE 3 VACANCES AT THE WEST ROXBURY CAMPUS AND ONE POSITION AT JAMAICA PLAIN*****

The General Engineer is an integral part of the design, construction and maintenance team at the facility to support a fully accredited healthcare facility campus. The incumbent is a professional engineer who supports the operation, maintenance, renovation, and construction of multiple sits such as outpatient clinics and leased facilities.

Responsibilities
Determines requirements, reconnaissance, location, and prepares designs, specifications and estimates, including systems requirements. The engineer is accountable for integrating complex medical facility designs for architectural, civil, structural, medical gas, plumbing, mechanical, electrical, communications, fire safety, security, and specialized systems (elevators, patient safety lifts, pneumatic tube, etc.). The incumbent is responsible for designing in conformance with applicable codes and standards, as well as federal and state agency regulations, standards, specifications, and other criteria. The employee supports development and implementation of engineering policies, programs, and procedural documentation. Frequently it is necessary to integrate complex, special or unusual planning, scheduling, and coordination considerations to minimize disruption of diverse activities, provide for continuity of essential patient care functions, and avoid conflicts with other ongoing work, without undue economic disadvantage. Position also requires frequent interdependent modifications, adaptations, or compromises for successful integration with the existing architectural, structural, mechanical, and electrical systems and environmental conditions, diverse special equipment or functional requirements, and future long-range plans. The employee participates in resolving complex technical issues which integrate multi-discipline activities throughout the Medical Center as well as with outside organizations such as the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Department of Environmental Management (DEM), RI Department of Transportation (RIDOT) and the State Historical Preservation Office (SHPO). The employee is responsible for assuring the continuous operation of essential patient services.

The engineer performs audits and inspections of worksites to assure compliance, prepares reports and findings, devises solutions, and implements corrective actions. The employee is responsible for comprehensive technical and administrative management of the planning, estimating, development, design, and construction of assigned new facilities, renovation, alteration, modification work and maintenance, including smaller locally funded projects, large-scale centrally funded nonrecurring maintenance, building service equipment replacements and additions, and minor improvements, as well as delegated large-scale construction projects. The employee plans and carries out the projects by defining objectives; interprets policies promulgated by authorities which are senior to the immediate supervisor and determines their effect on program needs; independently plans, designs, and carries out work to be done; and serves as a technical authority. Employee performs scheduling and layout of operations and inspection and surveillance of materials, methods, and equipment used in construction. Employee plans specific objectives for the program, including required innovations and improvisations. Prepares detailed cost estimates for use in obtaining project funding and bid evaluation. Employee prepares correspondence, technical reports, estimates, fact sheets, status reports, and schedules as required to complete project assignments. Employee consults with contractor personnel to resolve difficult and complex unforeseen problems and latent conditions that develop during construction. Employee researches, analyzes, tests, and evaluates information, unusual circumstances, unconventional issues, conditions, and problems; considering different, incomplete, and often conflicting information and alternatives; and determines efficient, effective, and feasible solutions to meet the project or situation requirements and constraints both during design and construction. Employee prepares sketches or drawings and specifications changes to solve the problem and incorporates these change documents into the contract performance documents.

Other duties as assigned.


Work Schedule: Monday through Friday, 8:00am until 4:30pm
Position Description Title/PD#: General Engineer/PD02334-A
Financial Disclosure Report: Not required

Physical Requirements: The duties of the position require visits to all areas of the medical center environment. Physical agility and manual dexterity are essential in that the incumbent must be able to climb, lift, push, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, reach, and work in close quarters during project inspections and gathering of project design information. Inspections of hazardous environments require the use of respirators and protective clothing. The incumbent spends a significant portion of each day conducting field inspections; may often be required to personally oversee delicate or dangerous work in the field for long hours each day, such as overhead crane work, confined space entry, excavation and trenching, and high voltage field connections.

Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
12

Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a U.S. citizen to apply for this job
Subject to a background/suitability investigation
May serve a probationary period
Selective Service Registration is required for males born after 12/31/1959
A complete application package; Resume, Transcripts, etc.
Selected applicants will be required to complete an online onboarding process
Qualifications
To qualify for this position, applicants must meet all requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

GS-12 grade level:
Basic Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by ABET; or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics OR
Combination of education and experience - college-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:
(1) Professional registration or licensure - Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT)1, or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico.
(2) Written Test - Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico.
(3) Specified academic courses - Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d)thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program.
(4) Related curriculum - Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. (The above examples of related curricula are not all-inclusive.)

Specialized Experience: In addition to the basic requirements, applicants must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS 11 grade. Experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSA's) and other characteristics to perform successfully the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled, in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization. Specialized experience includes knowledge of professional engineering practices in energy applications, design, construction, project management, cost factors, and life cycle cost analysis.

Title: Supervisory General Engineer
job description:
Duties
Summary
This position is located in Engineering Service, Project Section, Department of Veterans Affairs, Hampton, VA Medical Center, Hampton, Virginia. The duties of this position involve performing professional engineering and scientific work such as applying expert professional knowledge of various engineering concepts, methods, and techniques to perform a variety of complex project planning and design functions for new facilities construction, renovation, and improvement projects.

Responsibilities
The Supervisory General Engineer is responsible for planning and operations functions of the medical center; maintenance of buildings, equipment and systems critical to patient care.
Preparing architectural and mechanical plans and the original and revised specifications, estimates, justifications, and plans
Develops initial plans for proposed new construction, alterations and additions to existing buildings, grounds and utility systems by conducting engineering surveys; determining requirements.
Works independently interpreting policies, establishing goals and developing deadlines.
Individually responsible for the coordination of the Construction Projects Sections.
Responsible for maintaining complete, accurate and up-to-date records, plans and specifications of all systems and equipment installed during a project.
Supports and works closely with Maintenance and Repair Section to assist in the accomplishment of tasks by providing pertinent plans, specifications and engineering consultation.
Responsible for managing the Computer Aided Facility Management System and Indus idrawings.
Responsible for the management of AutoCAD software workstations in the Project Section.
Reviews shop drawings, schedules layouts, and inspects all work, workmanship, materials, and equipment installed for quality control and conformance to contract documents.
Serves as the liaison between the General Contractors, Engineering, the Contracting Officer and station personnel.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.

Specialized experience includes: acting as a supervisor of multi-discipline teams and project manager to accomplish design and construction objectives; analyze a wide range of complex and unique problems arising in hospital construction, contracting, personnel management, and complex studies, and present assessment to senior management; and leading and directing interdisciplinary teams and to resolve complex policy issues, construction problems, customer service issues, and design details.

Duties includes:
Plans and develops environmental policy and procedures, reviews, performs analysis to determine environmental impacts.
Develops systems to ensure integration and tracking of cultural resources legal compliance.
Establishes project goals, objectives, provide findings and make recommendations to senior management.
Analyze submission of concepts, preliminary working drawings and specifications prepared by contracted architect/engineers for compliance with agency standards, policies, and goals.

Title: Manufacturing Process Engineer
job description:
1.0 About ESS, our team, and what we are looking for:
Energy Storage Systems (ESS Inc) is a fast-growing, venture-backed, multi patented, clean technology start-up, located in Wilsonville, OR. ESS has developed an extremely cost-effective energy management system that combines an environmentally safe, abundant, and non-toxic iron electrolyte with our patented flow cell design. Our advanced flow battery technology combines high performance with low cost, renewable integration designed for commercial, industrial, and utility applications.
Our team boasts decades of experience in distributed power generation and energy storage technologies. We are team building a disruptive, cutting edge technology. We are looking for motivated, hard-working, like-minded people to join our team of individuals who have a passion for sustainability, the environment, and who thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial setting. This position involves close interaction with numerous cross-functional disciplines, including engineering, and multiple manufacturing environments. Applicant must be comfortable working in a team environment that is fast paced and dynamic. A strong commitment to quality and continuous improvement is required.
2.0 Position Profile:
ESS is looking for a motivated and versatile Manufacturing Process Engineer to join our team. The Manufacturing Process Engineer will be engaged in a wide spectrum of activities including completing process transfer, work instructions, and business processes.
3.0 Qualifications
Demonstrated ability to do hands-on troubleshooting, assembly and engineering validation work required.
Demonstrated experience with process improvements, equipment validation and data analysis methods required
Demonstrated experience improving processes using Statistical process control, 6 sigma methods, DOE, KPI’s and advanced analytical methods is required.
Demonstrated experience participating in or managing concurrent technical projects
Self-starter who is also highly productive when not supervised to meet the agreed objectives
Demonstrated ability to plan and resolve issues that involve gaining cooperation of cross functional, multi-cultural groups and sites without damaging relationships.
Preference for candidates with design experience using solid modelling systems.
Ability to anticipate needs of the manufacturing process.
Ability to read and interpret technical/assembly drawings
Preference for candidates with NPI or process transfer experience.
Possesses good written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
Demonstrates persistence, good judgment, strong decision making, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, and overcoming obstacles.
Uses good time management
Proficient using a PC in a Windows environment with knowledge of Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel.
4.0 Primary Responsibilities & Core Duties
Conduct detailed troubleshooting and analysis of issues that affect reliability, performance, cost etc. on production floor.
Provide input or participate in new product introduction projects.
Build Bill of Materials in ERP software and confirm details from engineering design BOM.
Coordinate change order processes for floor staff to communicate latest BOM updates.
Capture redlines and submit change request for design updates.
Perform hands-on assembly, testing and training of personnel as required during project work (i.e., assembly, test, or measurement, troubleshooting)
Facilitates and may lead cross-functional improvement and other Operations projects
Characterize and improve process and product performance
Provide technical support to the factory, to ensure that ESS is capable of shipping quality products on-time to its customers
Develop and maintain technical product and process documentation through ECO process
This includes the use of statistical analysis, 7-Step Problem Solving or other established methods
Provide supply chain support including vendor qualification and quality issue resolution
Support Field Service/TSS with product escalations, as necessary. May require some on-site support at customers
Adhere to safety, environmental, Sarbanes-Oxley and other regulatory standards
Maintain at all time acceptable housekeeping standards to keep production work areas clean
Other warehouse / shop duties as assigned (back-up for shipping & receiving, various facilities related projects).
5.0 Additional Requirements & Qualifications
Legally authorized, U.S. Citizenship or permanent residency.
Ability to fluently read and write English, comprehend, and follow verbal and written instructions.
Ability to follow job required Standards and Safety Protocols, per pre-defined processes.
Must be able to wear Personal Protection Equipment according to OSHA rules and regulations.
Must be willing to submit to a Background Check and a Drug Test according to the BOLI rules and Regulations.
Regular, consistent, and punctual attendance is required.
Experience
Demonstrated experience building/supporting complex electro-mechanical assemblies
Experience with chemical and chemical processing environments a plus
Experience with both manual and automated manufacturing processes desired
Demonstrated problem solving skills, ability to apply critical thinking
Quality system awareness
Knowledge of ISO a plus
Experience with the properties of common plastics used in manufacturing.
Education
University degree in Mechanical, Industrial, or other Engineering field, or a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the required skills.
Preference for experience in large capital equipment manufacturing or medium volume repetitive assembly techniques
Typically, 5-10 years of technical experience in a complex product manufacturing environment in service, development, or manufacturing
Intermediate to advanced shop math. Knowledge of English/Metric system measurement.
Physical Demands
Willingness to travel up to 10%
Must have ability to obtain a valid passport and travel regionally and internationally as required
Regular, consistent, and punctual attendance is required.

Benefits: In addition to the value of working with and helping grow a global reaching clean technology, headquartered in the middle of the beautiful Pacific Northwest valley, ESS offers a competitive benefits package: Company assisted Health insurance, Medical & Dental; FLEX spending account; 6 paid holidays; 401K, a generous PTO accrual; and public transportation assistance.

Title: Interdisciplinary
job description:
Duties
Summary
About the Position: This is an Interdisciplinary, GS-12 position with the US Army Corps of Engineers, Galveston District (SWG), Galveston District, Operations Division, located in Galveston, TX.

Responsibilities
Assess asset condition in terms of a variety of physical failure modes, and nonphysical deficiencies such as design flaws, statue violations and safety hazards.
Identify and quantify impacts and adverse consequences related to asset failures throughout an array of infrastructures.
Responsible for observing all safety rules, regulations, and directives applicable to the work assignment.
Apply available software or develop prototype tools to complete the necessary tasks.
Quantify risk using recognized analytic techniques to do so.
Allocate project funds to measures and monitors performance to assume commitments of all parties are being maintained.
Control and manages project milestones and budgets from initiation through construction and operations.
Travel Required
25% or less - You may be expected to Travel (TDY) up to 25% of the time for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
None

0401 General Natural Resources Management And Biological Sciences
0801 General Engineering
0807 Landscape Architecture
0808 Architecture
0810 Civil Engineering
0896 Industrial Engineering
1301 General Physical Science

Engineers, Architectural
Engineers, Civil

Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.
Qualifications
Who May Apply: Only applicants who meet one of the employment authority categories below are eligible to apply for this job. You will be asked to identify which category or categories you meet, and to provide documents which prove you meet the category or categories you selected. See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities.

Current Department of Army Civilian Employees
Domestic Defense Industrial Base/Major Range and Test Facilities Base Civilian Personnel Workforce
Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan
Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act
Military Spouses, under Executive Order (E.O.) 13473
Priority Placement Program, DoD Military Spouse Preference (MSP) Eligible
Veterans Employment Opportunity Act (VEOA) of 1998


In order to qualify, you must meet the experience and education requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.

Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes: 1) Manage planning for project development; AND 2) Analyze cost estimates for budget plans AND 3) Implementing policies in the development of projects. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-11).

You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas:
Budget Administration
Engineering and Technology
Oral Communication
Planning and Evaluating


Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-11).

Basic Requirement for Biologist (0401):
A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in biological sciences, agriculture, natural resource management, chemistry, or related disciplines appropriate to the position.
OR
B. Combination of Education and Experience: Courses equivalent to a major, as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education.

Basic Requirement for General Engineer/Civil Engineer/Mechanical Engineer/Electrical Engineer/Industrial Engineer (0801/0810/0896):
A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); OR (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.
OR
B. Combination of Education and Experience: College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:
1. Professional registration or licensure - Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.
2. Written Test - Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination, or any other written test required for professional registration, by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico.
3. Specified academic courses - Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included the courses specified in A above. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program.
4. Related curriculum - Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions.

Basic Requirement for (0807):
A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in landscape architecture or landscape design
OR
B. Combination of Education and Experience: For each year short of graduation, the applicant must have had one year of experience under professional leadership and guidance of such character and diversity as to be a satisfactory substitute for the required education. This experience must have included original landscape design.
Education
Basic Requirement for Architect (0808):
A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in architecture or in a related field that included 60 semester hours of course work in architecture or related disciplines of which at least (1) 30 semester hours were in architectural design, and (2) 6 semester hours were in each of the following: structural technology, properties of materials and methods of construction, and environmental control systems.
OR
B. Combination of Education and Experience: College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the arts and sciences underlying professional architecture, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the architectural principles, methods, and techniques and their applications to the design and construction or improvement of buildings. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by at least one of the following: (1) Related Curriculum - Degree in architectural engineering provided the completed course work in architectural engineering provided knowledge, skills, and abilities substantially equivalent to those provided in the courses specified in statement A above, or (2) Experience: 1 year of experience in an architect's office or in architectural work for each year short of graduation from a program of study in architecture. In the absence of any college courses, 5 years of such experience is required. This experience must have demonstrated that you have acquired a thorough knowledge of the fundamental principles and theories of professional architecture.

Basic Requirement for (1301):
A. Degree :physical science, engineering, or mathematics that included 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science such as mechanics, dynamics, properties of materials, and electronics.
OR
B. Combination of education and experience: education equivalent to one of the majors shown in A above that included at least 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science, plus appropriate experience or additional education.

FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html
Additional information
Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.
You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.

Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP). To receive selection priority, you must: (1) meet ICTAP eligibility criteria (2) be rated well-qualified for the position and; (3) submit the appropriate documentation to support your ICTAP eligibility. To be considered well-qualified and receive selection priority applicants must satisfy all qualification requirements for the position and receive a score of 90 or above. You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
Once the announcement has closed, a review of your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements listed on this announcement. If you are minimally qualified, your résumé and supporting documentation will be compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine your level of experience. If, after reviewing your résumé and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully when applying, errors or omissions may affect your eligibility.

You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation.

Title: Manufacturing and Controls Engineer
job description:
INTIGRAL is the fenestration industry’s fully integrated insulating glass resource. From our multiple plants in Ohio, INTIGRAL supplies just-in-time, mass-customized insulating glass units (IGU) and blinds between glass (BBG) products to window and door manufacturers across the United States.
The BBG business is growing rapidly and this position will be located at the BBG plant in Twinsburg, Ohio. We are working hard to increase our efficiency, streamline our processes and automate wherever possible. We are looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented engineer with automation, controls and manufacturing experience. This is an advanced position and you must be a self-starter with a minimum of 3 – 5 years of experience. It is also important that you display excellent communication and interpersonal skills, along with the ability to convey and present complex information to individuals at all levels. You will be tasked with learning existing equipment and processes to supporting operations before using automation to build our future manufacturing equipment.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Involvement with capital projects from new equipment purchase, equipment improvement and identifying required spare parts to minimize downtime.
Review maintenance reports, material specifications to ensure proper processes.
Analyze, recommend, and assist with improving the existing work order and notification methods.
Working closely with maintenance and production to keep the plant operating well.
Purchase and source replacement parts as required.
Working closely with the Maintenance planner and maintenance personnel to develop/verify spare parts inventory.
Develop Cost savings.
Lead effective root cause investigation and corrective action implementation to eliminate equipment downtime
Design and implement equipment and methods to improve operating efficiencies and quality of products, including implementation of preventative maintenance schedules
Maintain/improve engineering specifications, work instructions, assembly guides and related information to create best practices for manufacturing
Skills and Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, electrical engineering, or mechanical engineering. Work experience of 3 – 5 years minimum in an industrial setting preferred.
In depth knowledge of machinery and controls
Experienced in PLC programming
Must be comfortable interacting with employees on the plant floor
Fundamental knowledge of manufacturing practices and procedures to effectively resolve workflow issues
Strong planning, organization, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to gather, analyze and interpret information and develop, recommend, and implement solutions.
Must have ability to work independently with little supervision and as a contributing member of a team.
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office and Visio.
Proficiency with AutoCAD/SolidWorks.
Innovating. Integrating. Insulating Glass.
We are looking for a energetic and experienced individual to join our team. If you want to be a part of an exciting and growing business, give us a look. Medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with match, vacations and Holidays are all a part of the package. Check us out at www.intigral.com

Title: Sr Product Manufacturing Engineer
job description:
Due to contractual requirements, US citizenship is required and dual citizenship is not permitted
Responsible for designing and developing a product/product family. Ensures production procedures efficiently utilize materials and personnel. Tests finished product for quality purposes and recommends changes to product specifications as necessary. Requires a bachelor's degree in engineering and 4-6 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complicated tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.
Key responsibilities:
· Prepare reports and documentation
· Use analytical, Lean/Six Sigma, and APQP tools including PFMEA
· Root Cause and Corrective Action analysis
YOU MUST HAVE
· Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related engineering field
· 2+ years’ experience in Manufacturing or Engineering
WE VALUE
· Experience with technical writing of documents and training procedures
· Experience in evaluation of production processes utilizing statistical methods for measurement of performance and continuous improvement
· Experience applying engineering techniques to optimize manufacturing
· Experience in Military, Aerospace, or Commercial manufacturing
· Knowledge of the standards and specifications for Aerospace and Electronics for manufacturing workmanship, assembly, and test
· Familiarity with J-Std or IPC Soldering Standards
· Computer literacy: Windows, Oracle, MS Office, Visio, Project, SolidWorks, AutoCAD

Title: Design Engineer (Mechanical)
job description:
Design Engineer/Mechanical Engineer
Overview/Job Summary:
Gryphon Environmental, LLC is a design/build original equipment manufacturer and leader in advanced drying technology. Our products serve a variety of industries including municipalities, waste water treatment, and agriculture. Our flagship location in Owensboro, Kentucky is seeking to add a talented Mechanical Designer to our team who can help expand the capabilites of the Engineering and Production Departments. The purpose of this role is to increase the capacity of the Engineering Department in order to produce documents for site installations and the assembly of Gryphon equipment.
Responsibilities Include:
· Assist the sales team with preliminary equipment layouts and site drawings
· Create and modify P&ID drawings and submittal documents
· Create and modify existing product models and drawings to meet current client and production demands
· Produce and maintain complete and accurate 2D drawings and Bill of Materials for manufacturing and assembly
· Assist fabrication and assembly teams as required to complete fabrication and installation projects
· Assist in the implementation of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system
Required Qualifications:
· Associates degree or higher. Relevant work experience will be considered in lieu of degree.
· Driven strategic, forward-thinking, self-starter, problem solver
· Must be self-motivated, have a strong attention to detail and able to work with minimal guidance
· Proficiency in SolidWorks 2017 and previous versions; specifically with weldments and sheetmetal
· Willingness to work extended hours/weekends and travel as needed; travel is limited.
· Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines
· Ability to produce all necessary drawings and lists needed for manufacturing
· Positive attitude
Preferred Qualifications:
· AutoCAD and/or AutoCAD MEP experience (2D layout and P&ID drawings, site layouts)
· Knowledge and application of design for manufacturing
· Knowledge, understanding and application of PDM systems
· Hands-on fabrication and manufacturing experience
· Strong desire to learn

Pay: $45,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
job description:
Continental Structural Plastics (CSP) is an innovative and full-service Tier One supplier with a global presence and emphasis in development for lightweight technologies. CSP offers employees the opportunity to join a leading edge company within the composite material industry and enjoy the benefits offered by a growing company in North America and internationally.
CSP is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer for our Carey, Ohio Plant.
Position Summary:
The Manufacturing Engineer will implement new processes and equipment as well as provide technical support to sustain and/or enhance production operations.


Essential Job Functions:

Devise and implement new processes and equipment.
Provide technical assistance to support current production processes and equipment.
Troubleshoot equipment faults or failures and implement corrective actions.
Formulate, oversee, and implement continuous improvement and scrap reduction projects.
Interface directly with supporting departments and collaborate to improve manufacturing processes.
Document approved changes and improvements per IATF procedures.
Work as part of a team to achieve annual and quarterly goals.
Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering
Minimum five years of experience in manufacturing engineering.
Minimum Two years of experience working with Fanuc robotics.
Working knowledge of hydraulic and PLC equipment.
Physically capable of lifting approximately 50lbs.
Ability to work in high-temperature environments and maneuver through narrow spaces.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
OceanGate Inc is a leader in technologically advancing deep sea exploration, research, and commercial endeavors through its fleet of manned submersibles.
The OceanGate Engineering team is focused on the creation of innovative technology and solutions to further our mission in deep sea exploration. A successful candidate will be the mechanical engineer and participate as a team member within an integrated engineering team. This individual will be responsible for modifying and creating engineering details of components, sub-assemblies, and assemblies.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Creation of new detailed components and subassemblies
Creation of new design options meeting requirements and following these designs through purchasing, testing, and operations.
Conduct and supporting internal design reviews
Publish parts lists
Conducting peer reviews of models and drawings
Creating design solutions to support change requests
Coordinates with the engineering team as the mechanical engineering representative. Other disciplines within the team include electrical engineers, software engineers as well as, purchasing, operations and program management.
As required the candidate will need to support manufacturing, operations, and testing as needed.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
Strong of multitasking by owning several projects and running them simultaneously
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to research and investigate design solutions and work independently
Strong Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, etc.
Must have strong engineering skills including mechanisms, kinematics, kinetics, free body diagrams, pneumatics, and how stresses flow through a particular design.
Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship now or in the future
OceanGate Inc, fosters an environment where all employees are encouraged to share their passions and ideas.
OceanGate, Inc. is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Title: Lab Automation/Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Our central Iowa based client is searching for a qualified Lab Automation/Mechanical Engineer to join their research and development automation group. The Lab Automation/Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for developing, assembling, programming, debugging, implementation, supporting, and enhancing electromechanical automated lab equipment used in research and development. If this sounds like a fit, apply today!
Responsibilities:
Design and build automated high throughput lab equipment
Identify inefficiencies and improve lab processes and equipment related to productivity, quality, and safety
Program and troubleshoot automation protocols on robotic liquid handlers
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists
Research and communicate with outside vendors for skills, technologies, and products in the development of new products and processes
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in mechanical, chemical, electrical, biomedical, or agricultural engineering
Minimum of 3 years experience in the field or a related area
Proven track record of developing, programming, and supporting automation solutions involving liquid handling mechanisms, electrical/electronic systems, optical assemblies, and pneumatics
Solid understanding of robotic programming utilizing C, C++ language
Key competencies include strong mechanical aptitude, results orientation, customer focus, teamwork, and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with CAD system (or equivalent) and computer interfacing for system set-up, troubleshooting, and debugging
A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected
Some travel is required to work on field testing and to collaborate with engineers & customers in other locations

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Manufacturing Mechanical Engineer - Entry Level
The Manufacturing Mechanical Engineer - Entry Level is responsible for using computer-assisted (CAD) software to develop detailed 2D/3D design drawings and specifications for products. Create, modify, and/or revise designs to correct operating/product deficiencies and/or reduce production problems. Review and analyze specifications, sketches, drawings, ideas and related data to assess factors affecting designs, procedures and instructions to be followed. Perform machine tests and trials to evaluate and improve performance of equipment. Adhere to safe work habits
Essential Responsibilities
Prepare scopes, specifications, schedules, details, models/assemblies and sketches from design to validation. Specify dimensions, materials and procedures for products, parts and/or assemblies. Adhere to client specific and company standard production guidelines, and project standards for quality control and assurance. Comply with all established safety rules, company policies, and procedures.
Utilize AutoCAD Inventor by creating 3D models and assembles for design or reverse engineering of equipment. Read assembly/detail drawings from customer/vendor supplied projects.
Develop equipment and facility models/floor plans for use in the full scope of projects assigned. Anticipate problems in infrastructure, assembly installation, and operation and resolve.
Assist in maintaining an adequate supply of equipment spare parts. Assist in maintaining clean, orderly and hazard-free work areas.
Perform other duties as required.
Manage and maintain a drawings and process of ongoing products
Minimum Qualifications
Education: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Experience: 3+ years of experience using AutoCAD Inventor in a manufacturing/production work environment. 3+ years of machine/mechanical/facility design. Working knowledge of machine components (bearings, couplings, gears, actuators, motors, chains, sprockets, shafts, springs, dampers) and hardware, fasteners, joining, welding materials, pneumatics & hydraulics, mechanical fabrication & machine processes, and finite-element stress analysis.

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Amentum is looking for a Mechanical Engineer to join our team in Springfield, VA to support our mission critical customer. Must be a US Citizen. Must be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret/SCI Government security clearance.
Responsibilities and Duties include:
Performs engineering calculations, prepares specifications, performs analyses, performs testing, issues reports and maintains related data on assignments of advanced complexity.
Prepares, reviews and approves drawings as required.
Ensures quality, quantity and completeness of the assigned engineering tasks.
Keeps proper engineering files and records.
Continually upgrades technical knowledge and capabilities and pursues additional coursework and training.
May provide technical guidance to a modest sized group of engineers, designers, and specialists.
Fully versed in the methods of business development and able to lead the preparation of proposals.
Fully versed with codes, permits and company cornerstone applications.
Fully versed with and can check and review the work sequence, general content, and the methods used to generate specifications for the purchase of material, equipment, systems, services, or construction within a specific discipline.
Fully versed with the process of preparing and checking of calculations as well as the approval, revision, retention, and storage of calculations with a specific discipline.
Can oversee the review and checking of construction and vendor drawings.
Fully versed in the collection and/or evaluation of data and information regarding technical and economic factors including physical, chemical, environmental, maintenance, operational, regulatory, constructibility, and/or schedule factors relating to a specific subject within a discipline.
Leads or assists with the development of manpower, man-hour, and labor cost requirements for a project and can monitor it to aid in evaluating the budget.
Leads estimating tasks and performs material take-offs for a specific discipline.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering.
At least 7 years of job-related experience.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
Working knowledge of computer systems and integrated software application programs
The position requires the ability to investigate, troubleshoot, and design solutions to problems in operational hardware and software.
Position requires the ability to obtain and maintain Professional Engineer registration in the state of VA within one test cycle of work start.
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret/SCI Government Security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
PE certification
Active TS clearance
CEM certification
