Title: Quality Engineers
job description:
STS Technical Services is hiring Quality Engineers in West Bend, Wisconsin whom are well versed in AS9100 Standards. This role requires in depth quality systems and problem solving subject matter expertise to identify and resolve issues and deviations before they reach customer.
Position Summary:
In this role, you will design, implement and audit quality management systems under AS9100 Standard, and monitor processes to ensure the products meet the customer’s quality requirements. You will also be responsible to lead and support quality checks for existing products and new product launches from design development phase, engineering processes and prototype builds. You will work in a team based environment to develop and implement best practices that promote defect prevention, reduction in variation and waste and provide inputs for continuous improvement projects while managing the customer specific requirements and offering technical support.
Responsibilities:
Quality Systems:
Develop, implement, and monitor continuous compliance of Quality Management system per AS9100 / ISO 9001.
Write and Review System and Product Procedures and Work Instructions.
Participate in the development of new products and processes or changes related to current products and processes to assure fulfillment of customer requirements and international Standards.
Perform product and process audits.
Ensure control plans and associated documentation are implemented effectively and maintained.
Assist with training of quality awareness
Reporting and Metrics:
Monitor and report daily, weekly and monthly on quality-related Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) including ppm, scrap, rework levels, non-conformances, etc.
Monitor Customer Portals.
Proactively identify risks and work with management and multidisciplinary teams to mitigate them.
Executing:
Identify root cause and implement permanent corrective actions for product quality issues and quality system deviations.
Communicate with Customers and Suppliers to address concerns and corrective actions as needed.
Participate on Continuous Improvement Projects and Lean and Kaizen events.
Undertake special projects as required
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering. (Mechanical, Industrial or Quality preferably)
3 – 5 Years of Experience working with AS9100 Quality Management Systems.
Strong knowledge and experience on Production Parts Approval Process (PPAP).
Interpreting engineering drawings and Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T).
Advanced use of Microsoft Excel
Solid use of Microsoft Word & Powerpoint
Strong interpersonal communication skills, Clear and concise verbal and written skills.
Demonstrate strong problem solving skills.
Preferred – Nice to Haves:
Certified as Internal Auditor or Lead Auditor by international Registrar Firm
Strong knowledge and experience on APQP
Experience on application of MSA and GR&R
Lean Manufacturing knowledge – TPS
Application of Inferential Statistics and Design of Experiments (Six Sigma)
Advanced use of Microsoft Access and SQL Server databases
Knowledge and experience operating CMM & PC-DMIS Software
About STS Technical Services:
STS Technical Services is a Top 100 Staffing Firm that’s partnered with some of the largest names in the aerospace, manufacturing, defense and industrial industries. Our professional recruitment teams put talented individuals to work at client locations all over the world, and we have hundreds of exciting career opportunities for you to explore! If you want to speak to a Recruiting Professional directly, call 1-800-359-4787. STS Technical Services is an equal opportunity employer. #ZR

Title: Mechanical Des/engineer (2)
job description:
Mechanical Design Engineer
To work for our company a person must be extremely detailed oriented, organized and be able to work "hands-on" with project applications.
The following are the major components of experience preferred:
A BS in mechanical engineering a must.
At least fifteen (15) years of experience required in mechanical component design.
Must be able to design and build electro-mechanical components.
Laser experience a bonus.
Design prototyping helpful.
A knowledge of industrial laser optics a plus.
A thorough knowledge of SolidWorks is required.
CNC programming and machining skills helpful.
Will work together with many engineers (east and west coasts) as a team to design and develop a very specialized very-high end piece of production equipment.
Design and engineering are followed by assembly and inspection of prototype designs.
Additional testing for performance and functionality, final inspection, creation of user manuals, creation of test and assembly procedures, evaluation of manufacturing tolerances and component ordering and full detailed documentation are required.
Must be a self-starter and be able to work well in a team.
Must have excellent communication skills.

#IND1

Title: Mechanical Design Engineer
job description:
OUR MISSION IS TO:
Empower people to connect with their passions, unleash their creativity, and
enrich their lives and the lives of others by providing quality experiences and
innovative solutions.
From our first quilting frame, the Grace Company has helped people connect to their passions
with innovative solutions. We strive to provide new opportunities to a larger community by
making what they love more accessible. From the beginning of a product's design, to the
services we offer, we focus on providing the best customer experience possible. Our purpose
is to enrich people's lives and we love seeing their craft enrich the lives of others. We are proud that everything we create, and all we help our customers create, is truly made with Grace.
Grace Company is seeking to add a full-time design engineer to our engineering team. This individual will provide design assistance on engineering assignments including products, parts, components, or portions of major projects; perform specific research to solve specific design problems; develop preliminary sketches or schematics, layout, detail, and assembly drawings; create drawings to assist in developing product designs; help design prototypes of modifications to existing products.
Must have the ability to visualize/conceptualize an idea and be able to develop that concept into a 3-D model. Will have some responsibility for design integrity, cost, scheduling, and manufacturability. Will be preparing layouts, detailed drawings, calculations, specifications, and instructions.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Create support documentation for new products
Design fixtures to use in quality control process
Design new products and make updates to existing products
Assist in creating installation instructions of new products
Develop preliminary sketches or schematics, layout, and assembly drawings
Create drawings to assist in developing product designs
Participate in new product designs/calculations for new products
Check/discuss calculations for machine/product loads and system dynamics.
Define acceptable product criteria for existing and new products
Create/maintain quality control documents for new and existing products
Build prototypes and test products to verify design concepts
Set up tests on machines to analyze long term results and improve on designs to increase product life
Set up tests on products to improve the product design and verify calculations
Test products when issues come up in the field or in manufacturing and solve problems when they are discovered
Salary will depend on skills and experience. Must have at least six months' experience in SolidWorks.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Health insurance
Paid time off
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Mechanical Engineering: 1 year (Preferred)
Work Remotely:
No

Title: Mechanical Engineer, ZP-0830-III (GS-11/12 equivalent)
job description:
Duties
Summary
This position is located in the Productions Systems Group of the Engineering Laboratory of NIST.

Are you ready to explore your future with NIST?

Your application package may be shared with other selecting officials at NIST with opportunities like the one you are applying to. Additional selections may be made through this vacancy.

This notice is issued under direct-hire authority to recruit new talent to occupations for which NIST has a severe shortage of candidates.

Responsibilities
The incumbent will conduct research in measurement science related to smart manufacturing processes and materials, with an emphasis in metal-based additive manufacturing. This research will include theoretical, computational, and experimental efforts for monitoring and modeling of additive manufacturing processes and process signatures, generating reference data related to these process signatures, as well as developing advanced methods, models, and data for characterizing performance of machines used in metal additive manufacturing.
Travel Required
Not required
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
03
Job family (Series)
0830 Mechanical Engineering
Similar jobs
Engineers, Mechanical
Mechanical Engineers
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a U.S. citizen
You must be registered for Selective Service if applicable (www.sss.gov)
You must be suitable for Federal Employment
Applicants must meet requirements by the closing date of this announcement.
Qualifications
Basic Requirements:
Degree: professional engineering. To be acceptable, the curriculum must: (1) be in a school of engineering with at least one curriculum accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) as a professional engineering curriculum; or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.
OR
Combination of education and experience - college-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying professional engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:
Professional registration - Current registration as a professional engineer by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.
Written Test - Evidence of having successfully passed the Engineer-in-Training (EIT) examination, or the written test required for professional registration, which is administered by the Boards of Engineering Examiners in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico.
Applicants who have passed the EIT examination and have completed all the requirements for either (a) a bachelor's degree in engineering technology (BET) from an accredited college of university that included 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences, or (b) a BET from a program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) may be rated eligible for certain engineering positions at GS-5. Eligibility is limited to positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of the engineering technology program. Applicants for positions that involve highly technical research, development, or similar functions requiring an advanced level of competence in basic science must meet the basic requirements in paragraph A.
Because of the diversity in kind and quality of BET programs, graduates of other BET programs are required to complete at least 1 year of additional education or highly technical work experience of such nature as to provide reasonable assurance of the possession of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required for professional engineering competence. The adequacy of this background must be demonstrated by passing the EIT examination.
Specified academic courses - Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and in engineering that included the courses specified in the basic requirements. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of a professional engineering curriculum as described in paragraph A.
Related curriculum - Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in engineering technology or in an appropriate professional field, e.g., physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. (The above examples of related curricula are not all-inclusive.)
NOTE: An applicant who meets the basic requirements as specified in A or B above may qualify for positions in any branch of engineering unless selective factors indicate otherwise, or unless he/she qualifies under the provisions of B.2 related to the EIT examination or BET degree.
In addition to the basic requirements, applicants must also have 1 year (52 weeks) of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-9 (ZP-II at NIST) level. Specialized experience is defined as experience in designing necessary experimental apparatus and conducting high fidelity measurements of process signatures such as radiance-based temperatures and reflectance of surfaces during metal additive manufacturing processes.
OR
Master's or equivalent graduate degree as defined in the basic requirements
OR
A combination of graduate education and specialized experience as defined in the additional requirements


Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Qualification requirements in the vacancy announcement are based on the U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualification Standards Handbook, which contains Federal qualification standards. This handbook is available on the OPM website located at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/
Applicants may request reconsideration of their qualifications determination within three business days from the date their applicant status was changed. Applicants should email the Agency Contact listed in this vacancy announcement with their written request listing the announcement number; explaining why the original determination was improper; what factors were not considered; and, should provide any other pertinent information that would enable reevaluation.
Education
This position has an education requirement. You must submit a copy of your transcripts to document that you have met the education requirement. Unofficial transcripts will be accepted in the application package. Official transcripts will be required prior to the final offer of employment.
Foreign education: Individuals educated in whole or in part in foreign countries must submit sufficient evidence, including transcripts, to an accredited private organization for a U.S. equivalency evaluation of course work and degree. View a listing of these accredited organizations from the Department of Education's website. Provide a copy of the letter containing the results of the equivalency evaluation with a course by course listing.
Additional information
A one to three year probationary period may be required.

Please also include in your resume a list of all publications and patents/patent applications on which you are a named inventor and provide the title and patent/patent application number for each. Qualified candidates will be considered in accordance with the Office of Personnel Management Direct Hire Guidelines. Veterans' Preference does not apply to the direct hire recruitment procedures. Selections made under this notice will be processed as new appointments to the civil service. You may not be considered for the position if any part of the application is incomplete. Your application may not receive appropriate consideration without the required supporting documentation.

DoC defines well qualified as receiving an overall score of "85". This includes a copy of your agency's notice, a copy of your most recent Performance Rating and a copy of your most recent SF-50, Notification of Personnel Action, noting current position, grade level, and the duty location. If you are determined eligible for CTAP and ICTAP consideration, you may be required to respond to job-related questions in order to assess your “well qualified” status. Responses to the questions must be reflected in your resume. If the your responses are not supported by information in your resume, they may be modified and, as a result, your score may be lowered.

Title: Junior Mechanical Engineer
job description:
JUNIOR MECHANICAL ENGINEER
Department of Research & Development
Company Profile:
Cellular Technology Limited (CTL), headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, is a global biotechnology company with locations and distributors worldwide. We are the industry leader in the development, use, and manufacture of standardized immune monitoring tools used in clinical and research applications. We are committed to offering meaningful work, competitive salaries, a full-range of benefits, including comprehensive medical coverage, 401(k) with company match, generous paid vacation, paid holidays, life and disability insurance, dental and vision options, and the opportunity for professional development and career advancement. CTL is fully committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and world class diversity.
Position Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Junior Mechanical Engineer to join and contribute to the success of our growing Research and Development team. The ideal candidate will possess a broad technical background with a desire to learn more. As the Junior Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for the following:
Design and prototyping
Research and documentation
Equipment maintenance and inventory
Project setup and cleanup
Position Qualifications:
BSME at 4-year Accredited College/University with 0-1 year field, internship, or equivalent experience OR an Associates in an Equivalent Degree with 2-3 years’ field experience
Experience with various prototyping methods (e.g. 3D printing, CNC, laser cutting, etc.)
3D CAD experience; SolidWorks 2 years (preferred), knowledge of Fusion360 is a plus
Knowledge of Mechatronics, Robotics, or Electrical is a plus but not required
Must be familiar with at least one programming language
Critical-thinking, problem-solving, and attention to detail is a must have
Ability to work independently when needed, or in a small team
Ability to document work thoroughly
Submitting a portfolio showing work examples is strongly encouraged, but not required
Local knowledge of the Cleveland area is a plus
No remote work, onsite only
Ability to travel
CTL is fully committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or religion or other legally protected status.

Monday to Friday

To help protect our employees during the Covid-19 pandemic we instituted a number of health and safety measures including but not limited to daily health checks/temperature monitoring, providing/encouraging all to wear masks, social distancing protocols.

Title: MECHANICAL ENGINEER
job description:
Duties
Summary
You will serve as a Mechanical Engineer in the SE & ALRE Group, Aircraft Launch & Recovery Equipment Department, Launch Recovery & EAF Division of NAVAIRWARCENADLKE. The position provides subject matter expertise on Steam Catapult and associated launcher mechanical systems including configurations, equipment and subsystem components, shipboard installations, testing and troubleshooting, performance, operation and maintenance, and continual obsolescence integration.

Responsibilities
You will serve as the recognized authority and expert consultant to the Naval Aviation Systems team for all matters related to Steam Catapult and associated launcher mechanical systems.
You will coordinate, review, and approve the technical activities of engineers engaged in Steam Catapult and associated launcher mechanical systems design, in-service engineering, test engineering, and production contract duties.
You will be responsible for ensuring that the Steam Catapult systems meet operational requirements while considering program cost and schedule.
You will inform higher level management on status of assigned tasks and any potential problems, challenges, and opportunities regarding the Steam Catapult and associated launcher mechanical systems.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
None
Job family (Series)
0830 Mechanical Engineering
Similar jobs
Engineers, Mechanical
Mechanical Engineers
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
Generally, current federal employees applying for GS jobs must serve at least one year at the next lower grade level. This requirement is called time-in-grade. Time-in-grade requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.
Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.
You will be required to successfully complete a pre-appointment physical examination
You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal
This position is covered under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA). You must be certified as a Career Field S- Systems Engineering Level 3. Certification is required within 24 months of appointment
This position is a designated Critical Acquisition Position (CAP). You must be a member of the Acquisition Corps, become a member, or obtain a waiver at the time of selection and sign a three-year tenure agreement prior to assuming the position
This position may require travel from normal duty station to CONUS and OCONUS and may include remote or isolated sites. You must be able to travel on military and commercial aircraft for extended periods of time
Qualifications
Your resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the DP-04 grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: 1. Demonstrating sound technical work experience in the theory, operation, and maintenance of the Steam Catapult and associated launcher mechanical system equipment; 2. Articulating mastery of Steam Catapult Launcher Technology, including: formulating, analyzing, and utilizing novel and innovative technical solutions for improving system effectiveness; 3. Testing and evaluating steam catapult and launch mechanical systems design to modify and extend theories for alternative solutions; 4. Coordinating, reviewing, and approving the technical activities of engineers engaged in Steam Catapult and associated launcher mechanical systems engineering support activities; and 5. Planning of resources to recommend trade-offs between cost, schedule and performance to accomplish major blocks of engineering endeavors.


Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management website:
https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=List-by-Occupational-Series AND https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/files/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800.pdf

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment.
Education
Applicants must meet the following basic education requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual:

Successful completion of a professional engineering degree. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics. Such education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position.

OR

Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration For more information about EI and EIT registration requirements, please visit the National Society of Professional Engineers website at: http://www.nspe.org

OR

Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico The FE examination is not administered by the U. S. Office of Personnel Management. For more information, please visit: http://www.nspe.org/Licensure/HowtoGetLicensed/index.html.

OR

Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and in engineering that included the courses specified in the basic requirements under paragraph A (above). The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program as described in paragraph A (above)

OR

Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least one year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily, there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions.
Additional information
This position is covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program.

Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement.

A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments.

If you are unable to apply online and request information about the Alternate Application process, please contact the Department of Navy's Employment Information Center.

Federal annuitant information: The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf

Military Spouse Preference applicants will receive priority consideration at the Full Performance Level (FPL) and if determined to be Best Qualified at the FPL, and selected, must be placed at the FPL. A BQ military spouse possesses knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies comparable to others who meet the competitive referral criteria for the specific position.

This position is eligible for part time, full time or ad-hoc telework at the discretion of management.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
When the application process is complete, we will review your resume to ensure you meet the hiring eligibility and qualification requirements listed in this announcement. You will be rated based on the information provided in your resume and responses to the Occupational Questionnaire, along with your supporting documentation to determine your ability to demonstrate the following competencies:
LEADING HIGH-PERFORMANCE TEAMS
MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
ORAL COMMUNICATION
PROBLEM SOLVING
WRITTEN COMMUNICATION


You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation.

If after reviewing your resume and supporting documentation, a determination is made that you inflated your qualifications and/or experience, your score may be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities or you may be found ineligible/not qualified.

Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or consideration for employment.

All eligibility, qualifications, and time-in-grade requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.

Required Documents

Are you applying for a promotion? If you are a current GS employee applying for a higher grade than the grade that you currently hold you must provide an SF-50 that shows that you have held the next lower grade for at least one year. Some SF-50s effective within the last 52 weeks will not demonstrate you have held the next lower grade for at least one year (e.g. General Adjustment SF-50 from this year). If you were issued a DD-215 to amend aforementioned information on the DD-214 you must submit that too. Are you a disabled veteran or claiming 10-point veterans' preference?
If you are eligible to claim 10 point veterans preference you must submit a DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty as described above for 5-point preference.

You must also provide the applicable supporting documentation of your disability (e.g. disability letter from the VA) as described on Standard Form-15 (SF-15). http://www.opm.gov/forms/pdf_fill/SF15.pdf.

Are you an active duty service member? Active Duty Service Members are required to submit a statement of service printed on command letterhead and signed by the command. The statement of service must provide the branch of service, rate/rank, all dates of service, the expected date of discharge and anticipated character of service (Honorable, General, etc.).

Title: Quality Engineer
job description:
Title: Quality Engineer (MUST BE LOCAL TO CALIFORNIA)
Scope:
The Quality Engineer will support the work being done in the manufacturing plant on the product line. He/she can problem solve, follow quality initiatives, and drive quality with production and suppliers; the Quality Engineer also needs to understand how the manufacturing process runs; will support in assuring that quality initiatives are being followed by production and suppliers. Proficient in Microsoft Office tools.
Reports to: Quality Manager
Job Responsibilities:
· Root cause analysis and implementation of corrective action for process related concerns.
· Performs inspections and sets quality assurance testing models for analysis of components, materials in process, and finished products.
· Assist Quality Manager in establishing, implementing and maintaining the quality management system.
· Responsible for continual improvement activities to enhance the quality system
· Interface with Engineering and Operations to ensure transfer to Production of new products are in accordance with approved data.
· Support the quality inspection to ensure that products and processes comply with the relevant requirements of the quality management system.
· Analyze failure, corrective and preventive action to respond to customer complaints.
· Responsible for planning, organizing and managing the overall activities of receiving / outgoing quality functions.
· Continuously improving Quality Assurance receiving inspection process and procedures.
· Ensure timely resolution of supplier failure, corrective actions and preventive actions.
· Preparation of Quality Assurance reports.
Job Requirements:
· Business Thinking – sees the organization as a series of integrated and interlocking business processes. Understands general business concepts. Understands the financial framework of the organization. Establishes and monitors appropriate financial measures, using data to make informed business decisions.
· Communication – demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional work groups including suppliers, customers and associates, both verbally and in writing. Excellent listening skills.
· Initiative – proactive and takes action without being prompted.
· Organization & Planning – manage time wisely and effectively prioritize multiple competing tasks.
· Problem Solving & Decision Making – identifies and solves problems, develops innovative solutions, acts decisively, and shows good judgment.
*
· Results Orientation – maintains appropriate focus on short- and long-term goals. Motivated by achievement, and persists until goals are reached, conveying a sense of urgency.
3-5 years in an ISO9001 environment
3-5 years leading problem solving activities
Must live in, or within 2 hours of Escondido, CA
Sponsorship is not available at this time

· Bachelor’s degree in engineering or 4 plus years equivalent experience, prefer Manufacturing or Mechanical.
· Exceptional mechanical aptitude (i.e. intuitive understanding of mechanical processes)

job description:

Title: Mechanical Process Engineer
job description:
Accurate Energetic Systems, LLC, a leader in the manufacture of explosive products for commercial, military, and aerospace applications, is in search of a mechanical, manufacturing, or process engineer to join our growing team in middle TN. The candidate is expected to work in a fast-paced manufacturing environment where safety is a top priority.
The ideal candidate will have good mechanical aptitude with hands-on experience, prosper in a hands-on manufacturing environment, and have a very broad skill set.
In addition to technical merit, the ideal candidate must be a good cultural fit for our team. She or he will be comfortable interacting with the team on a personal level and understand that at AES, an employee is not a number, they are a member of the team. We are looking for a candidate with a take-charge, can-do attitude. They must be a self-starter, self-motivating, and be comfortable interacting with others.
The candidate’s main responsibilities will include:
Evaluate all processes in the plant and implement improvements based on operator input, new/improved equipment, design changes, etc. with the goals of safety, quality, and reduced cost/waste.
Research new or improved equipment, arrange for the specification/design and purchase of new equipment and oversee the installation and start-up of new equipment.
Design, purchase and implement new tooling and fixtures.
Be involved in the design of new products from proof of concept, prototypes, testing, pilot scale, and scale-up to manufacturing.
Participate in the quoting process by reviewing customer requirements; assisting in a bid/no-bid decision; and providing tooling/equipment costs, raw materials costs, packaging, cycle times, and labor hours·
Program/Project Management: Manage customer programs to ensure all customer requirements are met. This may be in conjunction with any other aspect of the job. Manage internal projects to ensure all project goals are met
Core Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering Technology, or similar technical field with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in manufacturing. An associate’s degree in a similar technology area with equivalent experience will qualify as well.
Ability to use 3D solid modeling. Experience with Solidworks is a plus. Experience with Autocad 2D drafting is also a plus.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs. Experience with Microsoft Project is a plus.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
An understanding of machinery, tooling, electro-mechanical systems a plus.
Self-starter with the ability to work both as an individual and within a team, think outside of the box, maintain schedule and budget, but do so with strict adherence to safety and operating regulations.
The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical skills and a desire to take a hands-on approach to solve problems.
*** Please include in the body of your e-mail the answers to the following questions along with your attached resume':
1. Describe yourself in five words that are not engineering/technical related.
2. Are you a U.S. Citizen?
3. What non-work related hobbies do you have?
** Due to government contracting security requirements, the candidate must be a US Citizen and able to pass a background check. Tobacco Free Facility. Pre-employment drug screen and post offer physical required.

job description:

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
job description:
MANUFACTURING ENGINEER
POSITION SUMMARY
The Manufacturing Engineer is a key member of the team resposible for opening up a new facility and relocating equipment from another location. This position will plan, execute and finalize equipment relocation plans including rigging, installation and optimal layout. S/he will work cross-functionally with other members of the project team on the sequence and schedule to move the equipment and ensure the lines are up and running within the project timeline and budget. The Manufacturing Engineer will make recommendations on resource needs and will work collaboratively with internal team members, third-party contractors or consultants in order to deliver projects according to plan.On a long term basis, the Manufacturing Engineer will work on continuous improvement (LEAN, Six Sigma) efforts and ensure that all equipment is in optimal working condition.
PROJECT RELATED RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Manufacturing Engineer will coordinate with manufacturing operations to develop the sequence and schedule of removal and relocation of equipment from crating, rigging, and moving through connecting to utilities, testing and commissioning.
Prepare detailed schedules for use by contractors to perform the relocation operations, including equipment relocation work instructions (ERWI).
Develop ERWI with equipment-specific instructions regarding disconnection, dismantling, cleaning/mothballing, crating, loading, protecting and transporting, unloading, reconnection and startup of the equipment at the new location.
Utilize strong communication skills, accurate documentation and smart planning to ensure successful project execution.
Communicate resource needs to the VP of Operations for project execution.
LONG TERM RESPONSIBILITIES:
Plan utilization of facilities, equipment, materials and personnel to improve efficiency of operations.
Provide technical support to production floor and maintenance when required.
Inspect manufacturing equipment with a focus on job safety.
Analyze workforce utilization, facility layout and operational data, such as production costs, process flow charts and production schedules, to determine efficient utilization of workers and equipment.
Recommend methods for improving worker efficiency and reducing waste of materials and utilities
LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES
Hands-On
Autonomous
Critical Thinker
Problem Solver
Team Oriented
Strong Communicator
Efficient
Adaptable
ATTRIBUTES and SKILLS
Strong manufacturing and process engineering skills
Solid planning and project management skills
Proficient in Six Sigma and/or Lean Training
Process Oriented
Excellent communication both written and verbal
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
An undergraduate degree in Mechanical, Electrical or Industrial Engineering
3+ years of engineering work experience
Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude
Lean manufacturing experience
Must have experience in manufacturing capital projects
Experience setting up a greenfield location preferred
Experience in high volume and high mix manufacturing environment (CPG preferred)
ERP experience (JD Edwards a plus)
Proficient in AutoCad/CNC Programming
Strong communication skills (Fluent in English)
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:

Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction
Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction
High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment

Title: Quality Engineer
job description:
Logoplaste is currently seeking to recruit a Quality Engineer, to join the team in Martinsburg, WV (USA).
Reporting to: Quality Manager
The Quality Engineer is responsible for the overall quality of the facility. Works with Managers and Employees ton continuously improve performance through driving and facilitating problem solving and implementing processes.
Key Tasks & Activities...
- Assist in the evaluation of Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ensure that local processes are aligned
- Apply principals for developing, building and organizing teams to meet company quality objectives
- Identify training needs, describe training programs and material development and apply methods for determining effectiveness
- Identify and integrate quality systems elements such as process control, auditing and testing procedures
- Understand and interpret Statistical Process Control (SPC) and Process capability data in a manufacturing environment
- Responsible for analyzing and reporting of Process capability data.
- Evaluate process performance to facilitate problem solving, continuous improvement and opportunities.
- Assist in investigation and determination of root cause and corrective action for customer complaints
- Conduct internal quality systems and process control audits
- Review manufacturing feasibility to meet customer requirements; revision of sampling plans accordingly
- Assist in closing out actions from internal and external audits
- Conduct quality training for each facility
- Assist in organizing qualifications for new and existing products
- MSA selection and improvement of measurement tools and instruments via gage R & R
- Support and drive continuous improvement throughout the plant (Kaizen, 5S, Lean Manufacturing events/training etc.)
- Other duties as assigned by manager
Who we are looking for...
Background and Experience
- Recognized academic or professional qualification and should be able to demonstrate strong experience in quality assurance and process improvement
- Experience in plastics industry preferred (injection molding, SBM, EBM)
- Experience with manual and automated inspection tools (calipers, micrometers)
- Industry experience in a quality related role
- ASQ Quality Engineering Certification
Technical Skills
- Demonstrated ability to achieve production goals in terms of safety, quality and customer satisfaction
- Ability to communicate and apply the 7 tools of quality and other methods used to drive improvement
- Ability to create, interpret and train Statistical Process Control Charting
- Knowledge of lean manufacturing techniques, quality systems and standards
- Good working knowledge of relevant legislation, including health and safety
- Proficient with MS Word, Excel
Interpersonal Skills
- Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.
Logoplaste offers an excellent benefits package with genuine career development opportunities.

Title: Quality Engineer
job description:
Responsible for planning and coordination of quality programs and activities to ensure the quality and reliability.
Develop, execute and/or monitor quality plans and quality engineering tasks, as well as, manufacturing process validations and controls to ensure compliance with established requirements and regulatory expectations.
APQP - Interface with Engineering and Operations to ensure transfer to Production of new products are in accordance with Customer and requirements.
Support the Quality Techs to ensure that products and processes comply with the relevant requirements of the quality management system.
Define and implement Safe Launch procedures as required for new programs and Controlled shipping procedures for Quality spills with plan to exit within a reasonable time frame.
Provide direction and leadership towards supplied parts Quality standards for production. Support initial supplier root cause analysis for supplier related quality concerns to confirm supplier fault. Work with SQ to drive Quality issues to closure.
Lead/Coach/Mentor/provide Quality support for Corrective Action(CA) teams ensure lessons learned are captured and read across to common lines and programs
Establish training needs for responsible programs/lines and ensure training is planned/executed for entire team(s)
Coordinate/coach plant teams in the creation of monthly reports/data collection
Perform Process/Control plan Audits - ensure status is captured and reported w/defined CA plans taken to closure
Highlight and communicate awareness of major quality concerns / Work and coach plant team members for all significant quality spills or recalls
Responsible to drive modification of standards/procedures based upon systemic lessons learned
Ensure implementation and compliance to Customer specific requirements
Ensures all CA's properly documented and verified (evidence of revised documents or on site reviews)
Monitor, Collect and analyze internal and Customer data from reporting tools to establish Quality performance trends, define actions to address these and drive these actions to closure.
Support Plant launch activities as needed – ensure compliance to Customer PPAP requirements
Provide general coaching and mentoring of the plant Quality team members (ie Quality Techs, etc…)
Pull and ensure accuracy of monthly charts for reporting purposes
Generate Monthly Audit Results/Status Presentation
Support Internal Audits / Follow Up on responsible Corrective Actions
Oversee and ensure compliance to Customer ES specifications – per program and Control plan requirements
Drive warranty improvement activities and 8D responses towards the customer
Provide training for lab equipment use, testing procedures and MSA issue resolution for responsible programs
Ensure common and accepted safety protocols for Quality are implemented as needed and complied with
At least ONE special project per year – Variability or Process improvement.

Title: Project Engineer
job description:
Position / Role
TAS Technical Consulting (TAS) is seeking to hire a Project Engineer (Mechanical Engineering degree/background) and ~5+ years industry experience. Representative responsibilities include:
Manage a portfolio of client projects (typically asset focused engagements to install, repair, redesign, expand, or remove mechanical systems and related infrastructure).
Scope project deliverables per client requirements and operational / site constraints.
Participate in field assessments and site reviews to identify potential engineering solutions and make recommendations for a preferred course of action.
Develop Statements of Work and related Work Breakdown Structures for project deliverables to identify required tasks and assigned accountabilities.
Complete/oversee design engineering (drawings, analysis, calculations, bill of materials) and related contract deliverables which are responsive to client expectations and needs.
Review project design packages to ensure compliance with engineering principles, applicable codes, recommended work practices and industry standards.
Resolve technical challenges and identify opportunities for doing things better and more cost effectively, while ensuring technical, operability, maintainability, reliability, and safety parameters are attained.
Coordinate and provide technical support for permit, agency, and third-party approvals.
Liaise externally with client, contractors, equipment vendors, service providers, utilities, and permitting agencies to progress projects from inception to start-up / completion.
Evaluate prospective vendors and contractors, including writing Bid Instructions, hosting Bid Events, responding to RFP questions and preparing Bid Tab recommendations.
Prepare Project Schedules and proactively manage Critical Path items.
Prepare Project Execution Plans and coordinate Resource Loading with contractors.
Develop Total Installed Cost Estimates / provide Value Engineering recommendations.
Evaluate Risk Factors and prepare Risk Registers / Risk Mitigation Plans.
Support TAS’s leadership in managing business development and client relationships.
Mentor and develop entry-level engineering professionals on the TAS team.
Qualifications
Bachelor of Science – Engineering (Mechanical preferred)
Professional Engineer license (optional, preferred)
Master’s Degree and/or Project Management expertise / credential (optional)
Working mastery of CAD and specialized mechanical design / modeling software
Track record of success (e.g., academic performance, design, industry experience)
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and MS Project
Key Success Factors
Self-starter, with work schedule flexibility to meet commitment deadlines
Team player, collaborative, motivated by collective success
Command of engineering principles across disciplines (mechanical, electrical, civil)
Adept at project management (estimating, scheduling, task progression, risk mitigation)
Analytical focus, with strong attention to detail and task follow through
Internally driven, with bandwidth to prioritize and manage multiple projects
Confident, with aptitude for customer-facing and client relationship management skills
Work Location
Position is based at TAS’s office in Schaumburg, IL, with intermittent travel to client sites.
Application Submittal
Interested candidates should send a letter of interest along with their resume.
About TAS
TAS provides project management and consulting services, with an emphasis on technical applications and engineered solutions. We work with clients across a range of industry sectors, both on oversight, design and implementation of capex and maintenance projects as well as advisory assessments involving facilities and operational assets (e.g., technical due diligence, reliability and operability evaluations, asset reviews, front end engineering and design studies, detail design, performance benchmarking, and project justification analysis).
We take an Owner/Operator’s perspective on our client engagements, and we manage projects from concept and scope development to completion and commissioning. Our portfolio of work includes new builds, plant modernizations, commercialization and process scale-ups, office installations, repurposing facilities (buildings, spaces, and assets), system and equipment upgrades, capacity expansions, operational efficiency improvements, maintenance and repair projects, and decommissioning assets.
TAS is headquartered in Chicago’s Northwest suburbs, and we have additional locations in Chicago and Wisconsin. We primarily work with clients throughout the Midwest, and we selectively complement that reach with targeted, strategic-fit opportunities across the U.S.
TAS’s website is www.tastechnicalconsulting.com.
About TAS Technical Consulting

We work with clients across a range of industry sectors, both on oversight, design and implementation of capex and maintenance projects as well as advisory assessments involving facilities and operational assets (e.g., technical due diligence, reliability and operability evaluations, asset reviews, front end engineering and design studies, performance benchmarking, and project justification analysis). Our portfolio of work includes new builds, plant modernizations, commercialization and process scale-ups, office installations, repurposing facilities (buildings, spaces, and assets), system and equipment upgrades, capacity expansions, operational efficiency improvements, maintenance and repair projects, and decommissioning assets. TAS is headquartered in Chicago’s Northwest suburbs, and we have additional locations in Chicago and Wisconsin. We primarily work with clients throughout the Midwest, and we selectively complement that reach with targeted, strategic-fit opportunities across the U.S. TAS’s website is www.tastechnicalconsulting.com.

Title: Structural Engineer (Civil, Mechanical, Engr. Mechanics)
job description:
Becht is a 5 STAR rated Glassdoor company and a Top 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey according to NJBIZ
Kindly attach a cover letter along with your resume. Please note that only applications with cover letters will be considered. Please also complete and attach the Becht Career History form attached below. Failure to upload the Becht Career History Form will create a delay in the review of your application.
Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multidiscipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our full-time staff and our network of over 1200 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.
Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking a Stress / Structural Analysis Engineer, who is looking to take the next step in their career and join our world-class, family-owned engineering organization at our Medina, OH location.
Becht is seeking an Engineer with 3+ years of experience in the refining, petrochemical, fossil power, nuclear power or other heavy industry. A degree in civil engineering, mechanical engineering, or engineering mechanics is required.
The position requires exceptional first principals understanding of structures and statics, with the ability and desire to gain deep knowledge of design practices, codes and standards and fitness for service of industrial structures. The selected candidate will work with senior structural staff to provide calculations, reports, and presentations demonstrating integrity of structures, systems, and components subjected to loads such as dead weight, thermal, seismic, and wind. Reporting to the manager of Ohio Mechanical Engineering, you will be at the forefront of our most technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.
Your Knowledge and Expertise
Bachelor’s degree in in civil engineering, mechanical engineering, or engineering mechanics
3 + years of experience in heavy industry
Past experience in the design of industrial equipment and structures including:
Generation of basic shear and moment diagrams
Sizing of simple shear and moment connections
Strong sense of ownership in your work, along with a strong work ethic
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present in front of groups
Strong desire and willingness to learn new and unfamiliar things
Self-motivated with willing to investigate and learn without extensive direction
Passed FE/EIT exam
Working knowledge of ASCE, AISC, ACI
Working knowledge of RISA, SAP2000, STAAD
Willingness to travel to client locations

Desired Skills
Advanced degree in engineering
Registered professional engineer or structural engineer
Working knowledge of ASME and API codes and standards
Basic knowledge of piping analysis and software such AutoPIPE or CAESAR
Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:
A positive, collaborative workforce
Access to further training and development
Mentoring programs
Company and family events such as baseball games, go-karting, and bowling
Flexible work schedule with the potential to work from home occasionally
Opportunities that provide stability as well as variety
Work day events such as birthday lunches
Community outreach programs such as Red Cross blood drives, Toys for Tots collections/volunteering, and United Way campaigns.
Room to grow your career
Robust benefits include, among others:
Every other Friday off if you choose to participate in our 9/80 program
Gym membership reimbursement
Generous 401(k) matching
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, and 401(k) plans with company match.
Becht is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Design Engineer
job description:
To apply, you may also simply text SONNAX to 25000 and our virtual assistant Olivia will get you connected with our hiring team today!

Design Engineer
Are you hard-working and responsible? Do you want to join an honest and reputable company that is renowned for treating employees with respect and fairness? Does this sound like something you would be passionate about? If so, join our all-star team and learn how fulfilling it is to be rewarded appropriately for your efforts while you develop your skills and learn the newest techniques in a dynamic environment.
Our Design Engineer will be part of a cross functional team that designs, tests and reviews new drivetrain components for the automotive aftermarket and will be responsible for product development and design with a strong emphasis on design for manufacturability. The Design Engineer will participate in continuous improvement of products and processes as well as activities focused on our business priorities of safety, quality, and delivery (timeliness).
Your Responsibilities as a Design Engineer:
Participates in a cross-functional team that designs, tests and reviews new products to ensure they meet the requirements of both the Business Case and Development Plan.
Analyzes product or equipment specifications and performance requirements to determine designs, which can be produced by existing manufacturing or processing facilities and methods.
Provides technical information concerning design, manufacturing or processing techniques, materials, properties, and process advantages and limitations which affect long range manufacturing planning.
Independently determine and select proper materials, heat treatments, coatings, tolerances and dimensioning requirements for design and manufacturing processes of product.
Has the basic understanding and knowledge in the use of Quality Assurance inspection equipment and reading of data and reports.
Confers with research personnel to clarify or resolve problems and develops design.
Performs or directs preparation of product design layouts and detailed drawing specifications. Will also perform CAD activities and will ensure drawing specifications are complete and in accordance with Sonnax engineering standards.
Ability to interpret and create detailed prints, and engineering drawings.
Compiles and analyzes design, test, and research data to establish performance standards for newly designed or modified product.
Operates required machinery and equipment in a safe manner. Follows established safety rules, and established tool and instrument control procedures.
Analyzes test data and reports to determine if design meets functional and performance specifications.
Confers with research and other engineering personnel and prepares design modifications as required.
Applies methods and processes used to manufacture precision metal parts.
What We Need From You (Our Requirements):
Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) or Mechanical Engineering Technology Bachelor of Science (METBS) is preferred. Associates Degree or equivalent in Mechanical, Electromechanical Engineering or related field and 1-3 years related work experience or internships.
Proficiency in 3D Solid Works and PDM Works.
Experience in Product Life Cycle Management System, Proficiency in MS Office suite with emphasis on Outlook, Word and Excel.
Experience with geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GDT), gear and spline design, shaft design, as well as knowledge with manufacturing processes including aluminum die castings, steel and aluminum forgings, plastic molded components, and CNC machined components.
Knowledge of the mechanical properties of materials and processes such as heat treatment, cryogenic treatment and the effects on strength and durability are a plus.
Knowledge of automotive technology related to the drivetrain is desired but not required
Knowledge of Quality Management Systems ISO9001, problem solving, continuous improvement preferred.
Excellent communication and report writing skills, attention to detail
Ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment
Ability to wear required PPE for lab area, including safety shoes and eye protection.
Why You'll Love Working For Us (Our Benefits):
Health/Dental/Vision Insurance
Employee assistance program
Long & Short-term disability
Flex spending accounts
401-K
Onsite fitness center
Paid Holidays
Paid vacation and paid sick days
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday 8:30am-5:00pm
Location: 10 Spencer Ln; Bellows Falls, VT 05101
Pay Rate: $50,000 - $60,000 per year (Contingent upon experience)

Title: Lead Mechatronics Engineer
job description:
What we do:
We manufacture enterprise-grade 3D printers in Beachwood, OH. Our printers are world-renowned for their build quality, reliability, and precision. We sell to educators, print shops, and large & small companies.
What you’ll do:
Create and execute the company’s product development strategy including: new product development, field support, manufacturing support, and product life-cycle sustaining
Lead the engineering team consisting of mechanical, electrical, & software engineers
Lead all phases of new product development including: conceptual development, preliminary design, detailed design, prototype, testing, product launch, regulatory certification (CE & FCC), and upgrades
Lead efforts to fix problems that arise during in-house production
Solve customer issues that the tech support team is unable to resolve on their own
Communicate with vendors and serve as the engineering voice of the company
Maintain technical support documentation including user manuals, how-to guides, etc.
Manage the engineering team on a day-to-day basis. Recruit, hire, and train additional engineers.
Create Solidworks assemblies, parts, & detailed drawings. Perform FEA as necessary.
Develop embedded firmware in C++ and Python
Design and troubleshoot printed circuit boards
Optimize printing profiles and settings (e.g. feeds & speeds) to obtain world-class output
Treat each customer like gold and be proud that you’re making a difference in the world
Who you are:
You are a wiz at project management. You keep your team focused and on track to deliver results on time, on budget, and with technical excellence. Your live by your favorite project management tool (e.g. Jiira, Basecamp, MS Project)
You have launched multiple new hardware products through the entire life cycle - from conceptual development through to full production.
You are great at creating complex Solidworks assemblies and you love top-down design.
You create drawing prints that communicate your engineering intent with your vendors in a clear & concise manner. You are familiar with GD&T and use it when beneficial.
You are very disciplined about using proper revision control procedures on both hardware and software products.
You are great at writing embedded software in C++ and maybe python too.
You are good at designing & troubleshooting printed circuit boards.
You are great at DFM and DFA
You have a background in Lean, Six-Sigma, TQM, and/or ISO 9000
You know the in’s & out’s of regulatory certification processes such as CE & FCC
You are great at troubleshooting noise and EMI in electrical circuits
You have outstanding interpersonal skills - you are great at leading small teams to deliver world-class results.
You are great at explaining complex concepts in a simple & clear manner.
You have used 3D printers or are excited to learn.
You have a degree in engineering and 5+ years of experience in the field.
Why MakerGear is a great place to work:
You’ll have a lot of responsibility and get to see the immediate results of your efforts.
3D printing is a fast growing and exciting industry.
You’ll be working with a dedicated team of industry veterans who can design, build, and sell amazing new products.
MakerGear has an outstanding brand reputation.

Title: Senior Administrative Assistant, Pott College of Science, Engineering, and Education-N20055N1
job description:
USI’s Pott College of Science, Engineering, and Education seeks applications for a Senior Administrative Assistant in the Engineering Department.

Essential Functions:
Assist chair in preparation of correspondence, forms, reports, and memos; prepare mailings as needed.
Serve as office receptionist and receive and route telephone calls; take messages, schedule appointments, and answer inquiries.
Assist with routine clerical duties such as scanning/copying student materials as requested by faculty, collecting and scanning syllabi, etc.
Assist in the preparation of academic schedules (classes, faculty student advising). Under the Dean’s approval, schedule classes/rooms and enter into Banner each semester; report changes for room/faculty/max to Registrar’s office as it occurs. Assist Engineering department with SIAASGN for FLP/FTE. Under the Dean’s approval, compile faculty office hour schedule per semester and post on web.
Communicate with students daily, help resolve issues/problems/situations that may occur. Answer student questions regarding school policy, faculty availability, and general university procedures. Email student requests for after-hours access to building/rooms to security.
Assist with ongoing preparation, storage, retrieval, and presentation of ABET accreditation documentation for the BSE, BSMFE, BSME, BSEE, and BSCE degree programs. Assist in logistics management of the accreditation visits, such as display setup, conference room equipment acquisition, and arranging for visitor amenities.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:
High school diploma/GED with two years office experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge of microcomputers, word processing, spreadsheet, and electronic mail required.
Must possess strong organization and communication skills.
Ability to work with a diverse group of internal and external individuals required.
Professional working knowledge of multiple software packages, including Windows 10, preferred.

Standard work hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to 4:30 pm. Occasional overtime or irregular hours may be required.

$12.66/hr.

Title: Reliability Program Leader
job description:
RELIABILITY PROGRAM LEADER
IMMEDIATE AVAILABILITY
Responsible for clients’ reliability programs. Accountable for client retention, business improvement, operations, and technical expertise. Develop, prioritize and accomplish clients’ reliability goals. The correct candidate should be able to:
Develop strategies, project timeline, plan and lead project execution.
Manage resources, materials and budget to achieve customer satisfaction.
Generate reports and communicate results to clients.
Perform root cause failure analysis (RCFA) for chronic or critical equipment failures and identify corrective actions.
Conduct failure modes and effects analysis (FMECA) to ensure proper maintenance tasks and intervals are established.

Lifescience industry (Pharma / Biopharma / Medical Devices).
Required Skills: Root Cause Failure Analysis and Failure Mode & Effect Analysis; attention to details, organization, planning and problem solving skills; technical expertise in mechanical and electrical failures; ability to develop strategies and follow a structured plan, ability to meet project targets within specific time-frame, ability to work under pressure; ability to work in a dynamic and team-oriented environment. Fully bilingual (English and Spanish).

US Passport

Title: Machine Operator
job description:
We are looking for an experienced and highly qualified Controls Engineer to oversee the development of automated control systems. We primarily work with electrical and automated systems, so our ideal candidate has at least a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering. You will use PLC programming products, such as those made by Siemens and Allen Bradley, to create these control systems. You also must know how to draft schematics in AutoCAD.
Controls Engineer Duties and Responsibilities
· Analyze the processes of the assigned facility.
· Identify shortcomings that could be opened by automation.
· Design systems that can automate processes.
· Maintain and repair systems.
· Inspect systems to ensure they meet safety regulations.
· Designing and developing new control systems.
· Testing, maintaining, and modifying existing systems.
· Analyzing data and presenting findings in written reports.
· Managing operations.
· Working collaboratively with design engineers, operation engineers, purchasers, and other internal staff.
· Liaising with clients, suppliers, contractors, and relevant authorities.
· Project management within cost and time constrained environments.
· Understanding and ensuring compliance with relevant health and safety regulations and quality standards.
· Providing advice and consultancy support.
· Purchasing equipment.
· Writing computer software and test procedures.
· Developing new business proposals.
Controls Engineer Requirements and Qualifications
· Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Electrical, Manufacturing, or Mechanical Engineering preferred.
· 2-4 years of experience in a related field.
· Technical proficiency in some software applications.
· Strong cause-effect analytical abilities to solve problems.
· Excellent communication skills.

Title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Sensor NPI
job description:
About SignalQuest: Whit Kelley, CEO
At SignalQuest we have a focused, high performing team and a small-company environment well suited for those with personal drive and a desire to contribute to long term innovation. We believe in investing in our team members, empowering them to take personal responsibility for our direction and allowing them the room to create our future. This year we will make about 10 million electronic sensors in Lebanon NH, where our R&D, production, sales and management are located in a historic renovated brick mill building on the Mascoma River.
About the Job
As part of a small and passionate team of engineers, you will be responsible for designing a variety of electromechanical sensors. Your contributions will play a key role in commercializing advanced navigation technology and transitioning novel designs from R&D into production.
Engineering opportunities exist at multiple experience levels.
You should be comfortable working in a fast-paced and often uncertain environment while contributing to innovative solutions, demonstrating personal leadership, technical competence, and attention to detail.
Qualifications
The Candidate should have a B.S. or M.S. with 7 to 25 years of industry experience, having a primary background in mechanical engineering, with extensive experience in design of components, assemblies, machines, jigs and fixtures, waterproof seals, machining, cold forming, screw machining, 3D printing, laser cutting, injection molding, casting, deep drawing, wire forming, spring winding, stamping, cleaning, plating, anodizing, and painting of mechanical parts.
The Candidate should have proficiency in vendor identification, qualification, relationship management, quality management, price negotiation, overseas sourcing and logistics.
Skills required: SOLIDWORKS
Skills desired: FEA, ANSYS , physics, chemistry, electronics
Responsibilities
Design world-leading inertial sensor components, assemblies and housings.
Work with manufacturing to create right-sized tools, jigs, fixtures and machines to support the high quality production of products.
Identify, qualify and manage key suppliers for mechanical components.
Update and modify parts, qualify vendors, and reduce cost for existing products after launch.
Participate in root cause investigations, corrective actions, process improvements, product testing and qualification, and product improvement initiatives.
Develop new and improve existing processes and procedures for new product introduction (NPI).
Redesign exiting products to reduce cost and address shortcoming of existing designs.

Title: Professional Engineer
job description:
Company Overview:
Sunvapor is a project and technology development company that delivers solutions to difficult decarbonization challenges. Sunvapor is pioneering the deployment of solar steam, with commercial plants under contract for the fuels and food processing industries. Sunvapor has received $7 million in awards from the Department of Energy for innovations in collector design, automated manufacturing, and thermal energy storage. Sunvapor has an office in Pasadena, CA and projects sites in the California Central Valley.
Key responsibilities:
· Produce detailed design and Issued For Construction drawings of mechanical systems, including Equipment Location Drawings, Piping Tie-In list, Equipment & Piping Arrangement
· Collector assembly and management of installation contractors
· Pressure vessel, piping, and steam components mechanical design and engineering
· Value Engineering and Cost Estimation
· Identification of pressure and temperature limitations and PSV setpoints
· Piping Line List, Pipe stress modeling
Experience & qualifications:
· California Professional Engineering License required
· 5 years of experience in the design of industrial systems such as process piping, HVAC, boiler plants and steam systems.
· 5 years of experience in process instrumentation and controls (I&C)
· Construction experience as a plant engineer including lockout tag out coordination, and process start up
· Experience in construction methods and equipment; cranes, rigging, steel erection, foundations, total stations
· Familiarity with common industrial sensors for measuring flow, temperature, pressure, vibration, & strain
· Experience in selecting and operating industrial mechanical process equipment; pumps, valves, tanks, heat exchangers, and hydraulics
· Familiarity with ASME codes, NDE, and standards including BPVC Section VIII, B31.3, B31.1
· Ability to work at heights greater than 15’
· Desire to work outdoors at project sites initially in the California Central Valley
Education:
· BS Mechanical Engineering
Salary & Benefits:
· Compensation commensurate with experience and qualifications
· Medical, dental and vision coverage

job description:
SAR9105
SE&C is seeking qualified candidates for an Engineer/Engineering Specialist (Mechanical) opportunity for our customer in Oak Ridge, TN.

List if you have DOE or commercial nuclear site experience and for how many years. (use the words DOE and/or Nuclear)
Make sure the qualifications in the Job Description match the skills in your resume. (use the same descriptive words)
Keep your resume simple. Text only.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Education
BS Degree or equivalent experience
(more – see below – Special Training, Certifications, Qualifications or Licenses)
Experience
2 years’ experience in Engineering
Responsibilities
Provide technical advice and perform technical functions as directed by their supervisor, line management, project engineer, or Engineering Manager.
Support achievement of line management objectives.
Provide timely response to project and functional requests, as required.
Retain and exercise responsibility and accountability to their functional management for technical implementation of their function within the integrated project team.
Interface with their own functional management on work standards and requirements, lessons learned, work process initiatives, and technical issue resolution.
