Provide for safety in engineering activities and resulting designs, plans and instructions, via the ISMS process and appropriate engineering safety management programs.
Ensure that technical personnel are trained to the functional procedures.
Ensure that appropriate requirements flow to project implementing plans, procedures, instructions, and subcontractor documents.
Provide occasional technical support to other projects and functional group.

Performs engineering calculations. prepares specifications, performs analyses, performs testing, issues reports and maintains related data.
Experienced in mechanical engineering with emphasis on piping and pump design, HVAC design, general mechanical engineering, and engineering procurement.

Prepares, reviews and approves drawings as required.

Ensures quality, quantity and completeness of the assigned engineering tasks
Plans and schedules engineering efforts associated with assigned project.
Maintains timely and accurate oral and written technical reports regarding assigned engineering activities.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Title: Valuation Consultant Intern | Machinery & Technical Specialties
job description:
Company Description
MRV Consulting is an independent valuation consulting firm providing business valuations, cost segregations, appraisals, and litigation support services to a broad spectrum of industries for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, insurance, litigation and disputes, financial and tax reporting, among other purposes. For more information go to www.mrvaluation.com

Job Description
MRV Consulting has a career opportunity within the Machinery & Technical Specialties group located in Colts Neck, New Jersey. We are seeking qualified and motivated undergrad engineers who have the desire to broaden their skills as they pursue a career in the valuation and advisory industry. This position will introduce you to cost segregation, valuation, and appraisal assignments.
Responsibilities include:
Analyze technical specifications, construction drawings including civil, architectural, electrical, utility, and engineering drawings, site plans, construction payment requisitions, and other documentation.
Development of cost estimation of machinery and equipment, buildings, construction projects, and industrial facilities.
Assist with preparation of cost segregation studies, valuations, spreadsheets, take-offs, and narrative reports.
Verify completeness, reliability, and accuracy of data.
Assistance during site visits.
Responsibility for quality control, timing, and accuracy of deliverables.
Maintain and develop positive, productive, and professional relationships with clients.
Balance multiple engagements and responsibilities.
Assist other team members with various engagements tasks.
Perform other duties as needed.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Engineering - Mechanical (preferred), Civil, Industrial, Financial Engineering, or related field
Ability to integrate engineering knowledge with finance and economic skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) and Acrobat
Outstanding research, analytical, spreadsheet skills
Ability to work independently and in collaborative teams, and to adjust schedule to address workload demands and meet deadlines
Extremely comfortable working in a fast-paced and technology-driven environment
Flexible with travel requirements of client service engagements. Able to travel within the US and internationally
Professional demeanor & integrity, respect & teamwork
Excellent writing skills and communicate effectively to all levels of engagement management
Fluent in English is mandatory. Proficiency in a second language (both written and oral) is a plus
Interest in business, finance, economics, energy, and/or consulting fields
Knowledge/Interest in energy systems, power plants is a plus
No previous work experience required, training will be provided
**A cover letter is mandatory> Applications without a cover letter will not be considered. Upload your cover letter as an attachment or send it as an email.**
Details:
Position Type: Entry Level as Paid Full-Time Internship
Start: July/August 2020
Duration: 3-4 months, may advance to full employment
Location: Colts Neck, New Jersey
Schedule: 8am-6:30pm MON-FRI
Compensation: $200 per day

Additional Information
MRV Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and we would like to thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that due to the volume of applications we receive, we will only be contacting candidates under consideration and selected for an interview.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Mechanical/Process Engineer
job description:
Mechanical Designer
will consider newer engineers- you will be mentored by a 30+ veteran.
1. Basic Function
The Mechanical Designer (MD) is a critical position on the manufacturing team providing 3D model and detail drawing development for food processing equipment, machinery and systems. The MD develops and organizes documentation to achieve equipment form and function with attention to manufacturability. The role ensures design criteria for equipment functionality is achieved to meet or exceed the deliverables identified in the sales order.
2. Reporting Relationships
The role reports to the Mechanical Design Engineering Manager (MDEM) and has functional relationships with the Lead Engineer, Production Manager, Materials Buyer, Sales Manager, Parts & Service Manager, Quote Manager, and Sales personnel as well as all other designers and engineers.
3. Authority
The MD has the authority to make travel arrangements and travel payments directly. This role has the authority to request parts and service quotes from vendors, and requisition purchases for approval by the MDEM, but has no direct purchasing authority.
4. Responsibilities and Principle Duties
Understanding and adherence to DI Core Values and Core Focus.
Professional, respectful conduct with staff, managers and customers - always
Manage assigned tasks in project schedule to develop and meet scheduling forecasts
Follow instructions set forth by the MDEM and lead engineer.
Utilize Outlook and MS Teams collaboration software tools effectively and professionally
Leadership and Safety to support the welfare of DI and customer employees
Focus on:
o clean design as it relates to food processing equipment and machine safety
o understanding, contributing to and practicing DI design standards for documentation and release processes
o developing a high proficiency with Autodesk Inventor, Vault and Microsoft Office applications to support design process advancement
o familiarization with and contributions to advance DI manufacturing processes and fabrication capabilities – machine shop, welding methods and practices
o solid modeling parts and assemblies in accordance with DI best practices
o application of functional dimensioning and tolerancing as defined by ANSI standards
o design engineering innovation to advance product designs and manufacturing efficiencies
Tasks shall include:
Design based on DI design standards to satisfy customer requirements
o Support customer site assessments as required to verify installation requirements
o Develop part and assembly designs to translate sales system layouts into functional equipment/systems to achieve deliverables promised in sales order
o Solid models to develop part manufacturing detail and assembly drawings
o Calculations to support design decisions for rates, control schemes, utility consumption, performance and mechanical strength
o Modify and refine designs, using working models to conform with customer specifications, production limitations, or changes in design trends
o Accurate bill of material generation with zero errors and omissions
o Document organization and release to manufacturing
Manufacturing shop support
Time record keeping and task schedule management
Special R&D and business support projects assignments
5. Standards and Measurement of Performance
The MD shall be evaluated as meeting expectations based on:
Demonstrated schedule forecast accuracy and completion performance
Quality plan adherence to reach zero errors and omissions
Progress toward developing design engineering expertise
Adherence to project execution methodology and best practices
Demonstrated professionalism as a DI representative and team player with customer service scores in the high range
6. Education / Experience
Four-year degree in Mechanical or Mechanical Engineering Technology with five years of experience in machine design. CAD certificate and ten years of machine design experience in lieu of degree.
Minimum two years food equipment design experience
Demonstrated experience in all role focus areas

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
6+ month contract with extension
US Citizens only!
Will this role be remote or onsite? Will be a mix of work from home and onsite
Top 3 criteria/must haves for the position? 5+ years of product design experience, B.S. Mechanical Engineering, plastic injection molded part experience
Are there any technologies that candidates absolutely have to have experience with? Solidworks is a must have, Ansys FEA experience isn’t an absolute requirement but is strongly preferred as well
The successful candidate will envision, design, and test devices and systems for medical and consumer applications including:
Developing mechanical products, subsystems and/or components
Participating in shaping the product design through upfront brainstorming and concept generation, as well as defining functional needs, system requirements and verification methods
Applying creative thought and state-of-the-art technology to solve technical design problems throughout the entire development process
Working with technicians and or hands-on assembly and testing work in the lab
Working with Project Management to complete and or lead tasks within budget and schedule
Communicating results and progress using written and oral communication to project leadership and the customer
Generating design, development and support documentation following QS/ISO processes and procedures
THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS MUST BE MET TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION:
B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from an ABET-accredited university
At least 5 years post graduate experience in mechanical engineering
Design engineer experience in consumer and or medical products
Plastic injection molded part experience
Experience using SolidWorks and/or Creo (Pro/E) mechanical design tools
Ability to conduct technical activities with minimal direction and or assume task leadership responsibilities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
THE FOLLOWING IS DESIRED, BUT NOT REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION:
4 to 6 years of experience in the design and development of medical diagnostic or drug delivery equipment is preferred
Literate in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing per ASME Y14.5-2009
Experience using FEA analysis tools with a strong preference for ANSYS and/or Abaqus and plastic part experience
Experience with plastics and metal fabrication, mechanism design, materials processing, and the related design requirements and constraints.
Understanding of the FDA Quality System Regulation (QSR) and involvement in an ISO14385 operational environment
Experience in the use of structured methodologies and processes for configuration management and verification/validation activities.

Title: Engineer
job description:
Job Title: Engineer
Department: Engineering
Reports To: Engineering Manager
ROLE:
“Engineer?? But what kind of Engineer?” An engineer at Inland must be capable as a Manufacturing Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, Quality Engineer, and Project Manager. It’s not a requirement to be an expert at all disciplines listed above, but you should be an expert in at least one and able to hold your own in the rest. We are a precision sheet metal job shop/fabricator/contract manufacturer. That means things are always exciting and your day-to-day here can vary quite a bit. “So what will my day-to-day look like?”
RESPONSIBILITIES:
The standard stuff:
Completing Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) from customers and manufacturing process request changes from the shop floor
Completing and implementing RCCAs for errors/mistakes originating from Engineering
Working with our customers’ engineers on new designs/DFM suggestions
Improving manufacturability & efficiency, fool-proofing, work instruction creating, routing optimizing
Regularly working with Quality Engineering, Production, Estimating, and Customer Service to keep the shop humming and the customers happy
The less standard stuff:
Designing manufacturing lines
Designing fixtures and manufacturing processes
Creating and delivering presentations and proposals for new customer projects & programs
Creating, documenting, & improving SOPs
Evaluating new equipment for capabilities, benefits, and ROI
Creating, managing, and executing projects
Cost jobs and fix the ones going badly and losing money
Create electronic tools and metrics in excel and SQL
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
A relevant Engineering degree or experiential equivalency
CAD ability, strong SolidWorks skills most desird
2 years experience in Manufacturing
Strong leadership, communication, and people skills. No politicians, no shitty attitudes.
ORGANIZATION’S VALUES AND CULTURE:
We are a $40MM job shop/contract manufacturer established in 1964 that serves the ruthless and uncompromising high-tech Bay Area customer by providing everything they want when they want it. Manufacturing parts in one of the most expensive locations in the country for some of the most demanding customers in existence is not easy. Boring widget shop we are not. We need good, dedicated, engaged team members to keep the dream alive. Apply if this sounds like you.

Title: Mechanical Engineer (Hydropower)
job description:
Duties
Summary
This is a Direct Hire Authority (DHA) solicitation utilizing DHA for Certain Personnel of the DoD Workforce to recruit and appoint qualified candidates to positions in the competitive service.

About the Position: This position is a Mechanical Engineer (Hydropower) position with USACE, Engineering and Construction Division, Tulsa OK.

For more information on USACE Tulsa District please click here

Responsibilities
Responsible for the mechanical design and analysis of equipment and systems found in hydroelectric powerhouses and large pumping plants.
The incumbent provides technical assistance in the application,design, failure analysis, performance, uprating and rehabilitation, review, and authoritative consultation services related to hydropower and pumping plants.
The incumbent renders advisory and consultative services to all Corps Districts and Divisions that are involved with hydropower or have large pumping stations.
Reviews or directs the review of work by other elements within the district to assure product quality and transfer of expert knowledge between said elements.
Checks and/or supervises the checking of mechanical systems, calculations, and equipment selections and other data submitted by Contractors for compliance with our requirements.
Coordinate the resolution of mechanical engineering technical disputes with HDC and the Design Team.
Serves as a specialist in the section on mechanical systems involving unusual problems where standard design practices will not suffice or complex dynamic mechanics are involved.
The incumbent writes scopes of work for technical portion of A-E Contracts and checks resulting work for accuracy and completeness.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
None
Job family (Series)
0830 Mechanical Engineering
Similar jobs
Engineers, Mechanical
Mechanical Engineers
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.
Incumbent is required to have a professional engineering license (PE).
Incumbent is expected to travel (TDY) approximately 20% of the time to attend conferences or perform fieldwork.
Qualifications
Who May Apply: US Citizens

In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.

Basic Requirement for Mechanical Engineer (Hydropower):
A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); OR (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.

OR

B. Combination of Education and Experience: College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:

1. Professional registration or licensure - Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.

2. Written Test - Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination, or any other written test required for professional registration, by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico.

3. Specified academic courses - Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included the courses specified in A above. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program.

4. Related curriculum - Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions.

In addition to meeting the basic requirement above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the qualification requirements listed below:

Specialized Experience:
One year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-12 grade level in the Federal service which includes performing AT LEAST TWO of the following duties for new construction, renovation, or improvement projects: 1) Designing mechanical systems for hydropower facilities; OR 2) Reviewing mechanical design calculations, analyses, cost estimates for technical accuracy and cost effectiveness OR 3) Leading technical teams for negotiation and administration of Architect-Engineer (A-E) and/or Construction contracts, which includes the development of requests for proposals (RFPs) OR 4) Overseeing and training junior mechanical engineers and/or technicians with performing mechanical design related activities.This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-12).

Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-12).

Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone-no substitution of education for experience is permitted.

Education
FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html
Additional information
Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.
You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.
Two year trial/probationary period may be required.
Direct Deposit of Pay is required.
Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.
If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet.
This is a Career Program (CP) 18 - Engineers & Scientists (Construction).
Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.
Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.
When you perform a Civilian Permanent Change of Station (PCS) with the government, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) considers the majority of your entitlements to be taxable. Visit https://www.dfas.mil/civilianemployees/civrelo/Civilian-Moving-Expenses-Tax-Deduction/ for more information.
If you are unable to apply online or need to fax a document you do not have in electronic form, view the following link for information regarding an Alternate Application.
Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is authorized, subject to the provisions of the Joint Travel Regulations.
Permanent Change of Station (PCS) allowances may be authorized, subject to the provisions of the Joint Travel Regulations and an agency determination that a PCS move is in the Government Interest.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
Once the announcement has closed, a review of your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements listed on this announcement.

If, after reviewing your résumé and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully when applying, errors or omissions may affect your eligibility.

You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation.

Military Spouses will be considered along with all other candidates.
Background checks and security clearance
Security clearance
Not Required
Drug test required
No
Required Documents
Required Documents
The documents you are required to submit vary based on whether or not you are eligible for preference in federal employment. A complete description of preference categories and the associated required documents is in the Applicant Checklist (External).

As described above, your complete application includes your resume, your responses to the online questionnaire, and documents which prove your eligibility to apply. If you fail to provide these documents, you will be marked as having an incomplete application package and you will not be considered any further.

1. Your resume:
Your resume may be submitted in any format and must support the specialized experience described in this announcement.
If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations and you may not be considered for this vacancy.
For qualifications determinations your resume must contain hours worked per week and the dates of employment (i.e., HRS per week and month/year to month/year or month/year to present). If your resume does not contain this information, your application may be marked as incomplete and you may not receive consideration for this position.
For additional information see: What to include in your resume.
2. Other supporting documents:
Cover Letter, optional
Most recent Performance Appraisal, if applicable
This position has an individual occupational requirement and/or allows for substitution of education for experience. If you meet this requirement based on education you MUST submit a copy of your transcript with your application package or you will be rated ineligible. See: Transcripts and Licenses
This position requires a job-related license or certification. You MUST submit a copy of your license or certification with your application package or you will be rated ineligible. See: Transcripts and Licenses
NOTE: Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove another person's personal information before you submit your application. You may be asked to provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected to confirm your eligibility.
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.
Benefits
Benefits
A career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Learn more about federal benefits.

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Mesh++ designs solar- and battery-powered WiFi routers with a dedicated wireless backhaul for temporary or permanent outdoor installations. Our intention is to make last-mile infrastructure fully wireless, allowing for simple temporary installations and non-intrusive permanent ones. Mesh++ has completed installations over underserved communities all over the world with the goal of developing a platform that enables anyone to bring internet access to their community.

We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer to lead physical prototyping, design-for-manufacturing (DFM), and manufacturing of our next product. This requires hands-on development with CNC machines, laser cutters, 3D printers, and other rapid prototyping equipment. As an early startup, tasks outside of the immediate job description may be required occasionally. We seek individuals who are enthusiastic to take on new responsibilities as we continue to grow. This person must be based in or willing to re-locate to Chicago, IL to be considered.

This is a paid position, $80k-95k annual depending on experience, equity available.

Responsibilities:
Leading the rapid prototyping process
Giving mechanical feedback to initial design ideas
Rapid prototyping including 3D printing and CNC
Guiding third-party manufacturing
Sourcing applicable raw materials
Designing tests to obtain feedback from customers, determine failure modes, or to determine manufacturability
Mechanical (CAD) and industrial design

Minimum Qualifications:
Experience with injection molding, 3D printing, extrusion, and sheet metal fabrication
General manufacturing expertise
Experience designing waterproof electronics
History of bringing products through mass production
Ability to receive and act on feedback from customers and co-workers

Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with RF (Radio Frequency) characteristics and antenna integration
Thermal simulation experience
Familiarity with Finite Element Analysis
Ability to conduct empathetic design with customers
Experience designing consumer electronics or networking equipment


About Mesh Plus Plus:

Mesh++ designs solar- and battery-powered WiFi routers with a dedicated wireless backhaul for temporary orpermanent outdoor installations. Our intention is to make last-mile infrastructure fully wireless, allowing for simpletemporary installations and non-intrusive permanent ones. Mesh++ has completed installations over underservedcommunities all over the world with the goal of developing a platform that enables anyone to bring internet access totheir community.

Title: Mechanical Engineer I
job description:
Right Weigh, Inc. is an industry leader in weight management for commercial vehicles. We pride ourselves on customer service, quality, and affordability of our products. As Right Weigh’s business continues to grow, so does our need to add to our engineering team! We are looking for an entry-level mechanical engineer that's willing to get their hands a little dirty sometimes and have some fun improving Right Weigh products and processes.
**This is NOT a remote work from home position**
Our company is made up of driven, committed, self-reliant and professional individuals. As a small company of only 18 regular employees, the job requirements are diverse (We wear a lot of hats!). In addition to traditional engineering tasks, our team of 5 also takes occasional inbound sales calls, interacts with customers often via phone and livechat, as well as participate and provide technical input for marketing and sales strategies.
Job Description:
Development and testing of mechanical components used in Right Weigh products. Responsible for creating documentation both internal and customer-facing. Creating and maintaining Right Weigh’s quality system. Design, build, implement and maintain production lines, processes, and workflow efficiency in accordance with the product requirements. Other tasks as assigned.
Product Development
Design parts and assemblies using Solidworks 3D CAD software and create drawings and BOMs.
Participate in development projects and discussions to achieve department objectives.
Firmware and mobile app testing
Create work instructions and process documents geared towards an ISO-9001 quality system.
Work remotely or in person with outside vendors to develop and quote components
Draft and maintain product instructions
Design product labeling
Product Maintenance
Build, maintain, and improve production assembly lines
Respond appropriately and provide solutions and feedback to customer requests
Analyze and log returned products for continuous improvement
Update products and instructions to keep up with market demands
Research Product & Design
Product optimization – testing and quality control.
Maintain competitive industry knowledge for the development of new products.
Technical Support and Customer Service
Respond to customer technical support calls, emails or live chats.
Problem-solve customer technical service issues and coach staff in problem-solving techniques
Draft spec sheets and provide technical and application information to Customer Success & Marketing dept
Cross-Team Interaction
Establish effective relationships and collaborations with other departments (Marketing, Finance, Customer Success, etc.) to address business issues and opportunities
Working Conditions: (reasonable accommodation is considered)
Sitting or standing at a computer for long periods of time
Ability to lift 20lbs. overhead
Ability to see, speak on a phone, and use a keyboard/computer
Required Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent design and technical writing experience of 3-4 years.
Required Skills:
Ability to design using 3D modeling software to create parts, assemblies, BOMs, and 2D prints for manufacturing
Strong organizational skills including self-motivation and problem-solving techniques
Ability to hit project deadlines
Ability to self-manage time effectively
Ability to build positive working relationships, both internally and externally.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Business related computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with the commercial vehicle industry including market trends, technologies, products and mainstay brands.
Machine tool operation and/or fabrication skills
General mechanical understanding and experience with cars, trucks or other vehicles.
Willingness and ability to travel (estimated to be less than 2% of the year)

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Job Description
Mechanical Engineer
Location
Meridian, MS
6604 Old Hwy 80 W, Meridian, MS 39307
Company Description
Saunders Midwest is an innovator of hand-tools, consumer and office products for professional trades people, DIY’ers, mobile workers and arts & crafts enthusiasts. We operate in two segments: Hand-Tools and Consumer & Office Products. Our products are professional, durable and engineered for success. We solve our customers’ challenges by delivering quality on-time, every time, at a fair price. We think long term. We insist on the highest standards. We seek to innovate. We are honest and humble, but driven to succeed.
Job Description
You will be part of a team focused primarily on two issues: product development & manufacturing excellence.
Conceive and develop new products and improve existing products, using 3D software to generate drawings. This will involve a wide range of activities from testing and analysis to design/build and manufacturing design. Knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing is useful.
Enhance operations by designing and implementing improvements to our manufacturing and procurement processes. Knowledge of six sigma, Kaizen, lean manufacturing, automation and robotics is beneficial. Ability to design and create fixtures and jigs is useful.
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams, including work with vendors and contractors.
Ability to create plans and process documents and other materials as needed.
Handle other matters, as-needed (for example, quality support).
This is a high-profile opportunity that will give you access to the company’s senior leadership and critical projects that will materially contribute to the company’s success.

Title: Mechanical Engineer
job description:
Mechanical Engineer
Reports To: Engineering Manager Revision Date: 7/29/2019
Status: Salary/Hourly Department: Mechanical Engineering
Position Overview:
Mechanical Engineers are divided into three categories: designer, detailer, and designer/detailer. A designer works with the customers and our sales team to create new machinery or to design improvements to add to existing machinery. A significant portion of the designer’s time is spent on research and development. A detailer takes parts and assemblies from the designer and makes drawings, complete with dimensions and bill of materials (BOM) to show the workers on the shop floor how to make the parts and assemblies. Designer/detailers split their time equally between both aspects and generally work on small to medium scale projects.
Skills:
3D CAD software: Autodesk Inventor or SolidWorks preferred (3 years)
Familiarity of structural shapes and when and where to utilize them
Know steel, aluminum, and stainless-steel properties
Understand metal fabrication and associated tools and machinery
Comprehend electromechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems.
Experience with geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T)
Ability to draw up hand sketches showing parts and equipment
Microsoft Office
Job Functions:
Design custom equipment for construction, food, energy, and automotive industries.
Complete hand, spreadsheet driven, and/or Autodesk Inventor FEA software calculations
Troubleshoot equipment and determine design solutions/improvements.
Conduct peer reviews on co-workers’ designs, drawings, and/or calculations.
Attend project meetings to discuss status and design considerations.
Compensation:
This is a full-time, performance-based position; wages are commensurate with skills and experience.
Education/Experience:
Associate of Engineering, Mechanical (Required minimum)
Working engineer: 3 years (Preferred)

Title: INTERDISCIPLINARY AEROSPACE/MECHANICAL ENGINEER
job description:
Duties
Summary
You will serve as a MECHANICAL ENGINEER OR AEROSPACE ENGINEER in the F-35 LIGHTNING II PROGRAM of NAVAIRWARCENAC DIV. This position will focus on support of the F-35B in the role of the STOVL Propulsion Chief Engineer.

DUTY LOCATION IS TO BE DETERMINED BASED ON THE SELECTION.

SALARY RANGE IS AS FOLLOWS:
CHERRY POINT, NC: $107,807- $140,146 PA
PATUXENT RIVER, MD: $121,316 - $157,709 PA
ARLINGTON, VA: $121,316 - $157,709 PA
Responsibilities
You will provide program development and oversight of a major NAVAIR level or Component/Command level program (or programs) relating to research, development, testing, evaluation, innovation, and reengineering.
You will provide outstanding technical leadership in a frontier area which influences major research, development, testing, evaluation, innovation, and reengineering projects, proposals, and direction throughout the agency.
You will be responsible for major system development or the direction of technology-based research which has the highest significance to the agency's needs.
You will direct the planning of resources to accomplish major blocks of engineering endeavor which may involve the expenditure of major portions of the nation's industrial base and long range commitments of agency dollar allocations.
You will be recognized as the senior propulsion engineering technical expert, and will have responsibility for supporting engine/propulsion program goals and coordinating engine team technical efforts to meet those goals.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No

5

0861 Aerospace Engineering

Engineers, Mechanical
Mechanical Engineers
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
Generally, current federal employees applying for GS jobs must serve at least one year at the next lower grade level. This requirement is called time-in-grade. Time-in-grade requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.
Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.
This position is covered under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA). You must be certified as a Career Field Engineering Level 03. Certification is required within 24 months of appointment.
Qualifications
In addition to the Basic Requirements for this position, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the DP-04 (GS-12/13) level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Examples of Qualifying Specialized Experience: 1) Demonstrating expertise in aircraft turbine engine engineering on Naval aircraft and aircraft systems; 2) Providing leadership and demonstrated experience in engineering project management; 3) Executing Research, Development, Test and Evaluation projects to support agency goals and objectives; 4) Providing technical direction and guidance with resource and financial management in order to support the agency's short and long terms plans and objectives.


Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management website:
https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=List-by-Occupational-Series

IOR: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/files/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800.pdf

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment.
Education
Applicants must meet the following positive education qualifications requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual: Applicants must possess:

A. Degree: Engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by ABET; or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.

OR

B. Combination of education and experience - college-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering.
Additional information
This position is covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program.

Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement.

A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments.

If you are unable to apply online and request information about the Alternate Application process, please contact the Department of Navy's Employment Information Center.

Federal annuitant information: The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf

Military Spouse Preference applicants will receive priority consideration at the Full Performance Level (FPL) and if determined to be Best Qualified at the FPL, and selected, must be placed at the FPL. A BQ military spouse possesses knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies comparable to others who meet the competitive referral criteria for the specific position.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
In order to qualify for this position, your resume must provide sufficient experience and/or education, knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the duties of the specific position for which you are being considered. Your resume is the key means we have for evaluating your skills, knowledge, and abilities as they relate to this position. Therefore, we encourage you to be clear and specific when describing your experience.

When the application process is complete, we will review your resume to ensure you meet the hiring eligibility and qualification requirements listed in this announcement. You will be rated based on the information provided in your resume and responses to the Occupational Questionnaire, along with your supporting documentation to determine your ability to demonstrate the following competencies:
AEROSPACE ENGINEERING
ENGINEERING PROJECT MANAGEMENT
MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
RESOURCE MANAGEMENT
SYSTEMS ENGINEERING


You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation.

If after reviewing your resume and supporting documentation, a determination is made that you inflated your qualifications and/or experience, your score may be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities or you may be found ineligible/not qualified.

Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or consideration for employment.

Required Documents
You are required to provide documentation that supports the eligibility and qualification claims made in your resume and assessment questionnaire. You must submit the applicable documents listed here and those listed with the eligibilities you select in the announcement questionnaire with your application package. Applicants who do not provide supporting documentation that fully support their claims will not be referred to the hiring manager. Cover letter is optional.

A complete resume is required. Your resume must show relevant experience, job title, duties and accomplishments. Your resume must show complete information for each job entry to support minimum qualifications. The following information should be provided in your resume, but it is acceptable to provide elsewhere in your application package: employer's name, starting and end dates (Mo/Yr), hours per week, and pay plan, series and grade level (e.g. GS-0201-09) for relevant federal experience.TIP: A good way to ensure you include all essential information is to use the Resume Builder in USAJOBS to create your resume.

Are you applying for a promotion? If you are a current GS employee applying for a higher grade than the grade that you currently hold you must provide an SF-50 that shows that you have held the next lower grade for at least one year. Some SF-50s effective within the last 52 weeks will not demonstrate you have held the next lower grade for at least one year (e.g. General Adjustment SF-50 from this year). In many cases, we need to see two (2) SF-50s to determine time-in-grade and eligibility for promotion. If you are a DoD employee, you can obtain a copy of your SF- 50(s) from MyBiz.

Are you claiming membership in any professional organizations, or possession of a license, certificate or credentials? Check the Conditions of Employment section above to see if any are required. If you claim membership, license, certification, or credentials, you must submit a copy of said document in your application package.

Are you using education as a substitute for some or all of the experience requirement? Is there a basic education requirement for this position? Check the Education section above to see what is allowed and what is required. Any claims you make in your resume or assessment questionnaire regarding education or degrees MUST be supported by official or unofficial transcripts or a list of courses, grades earned, completion dates, and quarter and semester hours earned issued from your school. While unofficial transcripts are acceptable for initial application, an official transcript will ultimately be required if you are selected for the position. You may submit a copy your degree(s) if specific coursework does not have to be verified.

Are you a veteran claiming 5-point veterans' preference or claiming sole survivorship preference? You must submit a copy of your latest DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (any copy that shows all dates of service, as well as character of service [Honorable, General, etc.] is acceptable) OR a VA letter that shows dates of service or service connected disability AND character of service. If you have more than one DD-214 for multiple periods of active duty service, submit a copy for each period of service. If you were issued a DD-215 to amend aforementioned information on the DD-214 you must submit that too. If you are not sure of your preference eligibility, visit the Department of Labor's website: Veterans' Preference Advisor

Are you a disabled veteran or claiming 10-point veterans' preference?
If you are eligible to claim 10 point veterans preference you must submit a DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty as described above for 5-point preference.

You must also provide the applicable supporting documentation of your disability (e.g. disability letter from the VA) as described on Standard Form-15 (SF-15). http://www.opm.gov/forms/pdf_fill/SF15.pdf.

Are you an active duty service member? Active Duty Service Members are required to submit a statement of service printed on command letterhead and signed by the command. The statement of service must provide the branch of service, rate/rank, all dates of service, the expected date of discharge and anticipated character of service (Honorable, General, etc.).

Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents contain personal information such as SSN and DOB and some documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove said personal information before you submit your application. You must provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected.
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

Title: Robotic Engineer
job description:
PakTech headquarters is located in beautiful Eugene Oregon and is committed to the environment and our communities. PakTech handles are made of 100% post-consumer material and are repurposed from milk jugs and similar containers. We are looking for people as committed to the environment as we are. After all, we all need to do whatever possible to keep plastics in our recycling stream so they can be repurposed. If you feel committed to helping the environment and have the experience, we would love to hear from you!
Job Summary:
PakTech has an immediate opening in our Applicators Division for a Robotics Engineer. This position is responsible for the simulation, programming, and troubleshooting of robotic based electrical control systems. They will perform process control automation of new and existing equipment, and work closely with all team members. Strategic development from concept and design through execution, startup, and support phases.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Startup and troubleshoot industrial control systems
Simulation, programming, and troubleshooting of FANUC Robotics including coordinate frames, teach pendant, and setting and manipulating safety zones
Programming and troubleshooting of PLC
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with all team members to resolve problems and follow through with all concerned parties
Ability to provide support to the field service team including travel to onsite locations
Minimum Qualifications
Experience simulating, programming and troubleshooting FANUC robots, including iRPickTool and IRVision
Experience programming, troubleshooting and integrating FANUC robots using teach pendant with Allen Bradley Control Systems
Experience with ethernet networking and troubleshooting
Aptitude for hands on electrical and mechanical troubleshooting
Excellent problem solving and time management skills
Experience designing control system integrating PLC's, VFD's, Servos, Vision and Robotics
Experience drawing electrical schematics and panel layouts using AutoCAD or Solidworks Electrical
Experience programming with FactoryTalk View Studio ME
Experience programming with Wonderware/Indusoft Web Studio
Education and/or Experience
Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science)
Extremely computer literate with MS Office Products
Heavy knowledge of FANUC robots
Knowledge of UL508A, NFPA70, NFPA79, NEMA, and IEC
3 or more years of relevant experience
Experience with machine vision systems such as Cognex or Keyence a plus
3D CAD experience (SolidWorks) a plus
Overnight travel required up to 50% of the time -

Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.
Must have Contracting Officer's Representative (COR) Certification upon selection.
Facilities Engineering (FE) must be obtained/maintained within 24 months of employment.
Financial Disclosure OGE-450 is required.
Acquisition Level 1 is required and should be obtained within 24 months of employment.
Qualifications
Who May Apply: Only applicants who meet one of the employment authority categories below are eligible to apply for this job. You will be asked to identify which category or categories you meet, and to provide documents which prove you meet the category or categories you selected. See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities.
Basic Requirement for Engineer:

A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); OR (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.
OR
B. Combination of Education and Experience: College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:
1. Professional registration or licensure - Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.
2. Written Test - Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination, or any other written test required for professional registration, by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico.
3. Specified academic courses - Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included the courses specified in A above. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program.
4. Related curriculum - Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions.

Basic Requirement for Architect:

A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in architecture or in a related field that included 60 semester hours of course work in architecture or related disciplines of which at least (1) 30 semester hours were in architectural design, and (2) 6 semester hours were in each of the following: structural technology, properties of materials and methods of construction, and environmental control systems.
OR
B. Combination of Education and Experience: College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the arts and sciences underlying professional architecture, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the architectural principles, methods, and techniques and their applications to the design and construction or improvement of buildings. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by at least one of the following: (1) Related Curriculum - Degree in architectural engineering provided the completed course work in architectural engineering provided knowledge, skills, and abilities substantially equivalent to those provided in the courses specified in statement A above, or (2) Experience: 1 year of experience in an architect's office or in architectural work for each year short of graduation from a program of study in architecture. In the absence of any college courses, 5 years of such experience is required. This experience must have demonstrated that you have acquired a thorough knowledge of the fundamental principles and theories of professional architecture.

In addition to the education requirement you must also meet the specialized experience requirement.

Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes: Applying professional knowledge of engineering concepts, principles and practices applicable to engineering construction and inspection activities; perform contract administration to include estimates of cost; and ensure construction projects are accomplished in accordance with proper quality control and assurance procedures.

Secialized experience must be equivalent to the next lower grade in the Federal service-GS-11

Title: SUPERVISORY MECHANICAL ENGINEER
job description:
Duties
Summary
You will serve as a SUPERVISORY MECHANICAL ENGINEER in the Ocean Engineering Department of PSNS and IMF.

Responsibilities
You will supervise and provide technical and administrative leadership to professional engineering personnel, demonstrated by experience in supervision over technical project type assignments.
You will evaluate performance, approve leave, make selection for vacant positions, hear and resolve Branch grievances or complaints, recommend disciplinary, commendatory actions, and personnel actions.
You will delineate objectives and constraints, and establish priorities consistent with the needs of the Ocean Engineering project.
You will provide advice, counsel and instructions and review all Branch work and accept, amend or reject work.
You will serve as spokesman for the Division to make presentations concerning Branch-related design topics, as required.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
Yes
Promotion Potential
None
Job family (Series)
0830 Mechanical Engineering
Similar jobs
Engineers, Mechanical
Mechanical Engineers
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
Generally, current federal employees applying for GS jobs must serve at least one year at the next lower grade level. This requirement is called time-in-grade. Time-in-grade requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.
Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.
You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.
Successful completion of a pre-employment drug test (including marijuana) is required. A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if you fail to report to the drug test appointment or pass the test. You will be subject to random testing.
Must successfully pass a Counter-Intelligence (CI) Polygraph on a random basis not to exceed every 5 years in the performance of this position.
Work is performed in areas where potentially harmful physical and chemical agents are present (e.g. fumes, dust, heat, ionizing and non-ionizing radiation and chemicals). You will be required to participate in medical surveillance programs.
This position may require travel from normal duty station to CONUS and OCONUS and may include remote or isolated sites. You must be able to travel on military and commercial aircraft for extended periods of time.
Supervisors in the executive branch have a heightened personal responsibility for advancing government ethics. You will be required to review the 14 General Principles of Ethical Conduct at 5 CFR 2635.101.
Qualifications
Your resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the next lower grade level (GS-12) or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector as professional ENGINEER applying advanced theories of mechanical engineering to direct technical engineering projects and resolve issues associated with the waterfront execution, installation, and operation of equipment for deep submergence naval vessels.

Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management website:
https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=GS-PROF AND https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/files/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800.pdf

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment.
Education
Applicants must meet the following basic education requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual:

Successful completion of a professional engineering degree. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics. Such education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position; OR

Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration For more information about EI and EIT registration requirements, please visit the National Society of Professional Engineers website at: http://www.nspe.org; OR

Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico The FE examination is not administered by the U. S. Office of Personnel Management. For more information, please visit: http://www.nspe.org/Licensure/HowtoGetLicensed/index.html.; OR

Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and in engineering that included the courses specified in the basic requirements above. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program as described in above; OR

Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least one year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily, there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions.
Additional information
This position is covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program.

Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement.

A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments.

If you are unable to apply online and request information about the Alternate Application process, please contact the Department of Navy's Employment Information Center.

This position is subject to work an uncommon tour, including nights, weekends, and holidays to meet mission requirements. Overtime or night differential pay and/or unusual duty hours may be required.

Federal annuitant information: The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf

Military Spouse Preference applicants will receive priority consideration at the Full Performance Level (FPL) and if determined to be Best Qualified at the FPL, and selected, must be placed at the FPL. A BQ military spouse possesses knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies comparable to others who meet the competitive referral criteria for the specific position.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
When the application process is complete, we will review your resume to ensure you meet the hiring eligibility and qualification requirements listed in this announcement. You will be rated based on the information provided in your resume and responses to the Occupational Questionnaire, along with your supporting documentation to determine your ability to demonstrate the following competencies:
ENGINEERING PROJECT MANAGEMENT
MANAGING HUMAN RESOURCES
MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
ORAL COMMUNICATION
SYSTEMS ENGINEERING

If after reviewing your resume and supporting documentation, a determination is made that you inflated your qualifications and/or experience, your score may be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities or you may be found ineligible/not qualified.

Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or consideration for employment.

All eligibility, qualifications, and time-in-grade requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
job description:
Ready to help us disrupt the manufacturing industry as a Manufacturing Engineer? Then, let’s talk!
What You’ll Do
Responsible for developing, evaluating, and reviewing manufacturing plans and set-up sheets in support of the manufacturing process.
Utilize Mastercam to develop CNC programs, continuously improving upon existing processes and updating programs accordingly.
Utilize Solidworks to lead the design of work-holding and tooling to support production schedules.
Evaluate existing machining processes to identify opportunities to improve throughput, decrease change-over times, and enhance operator performance.
Define and maintain manufacturing processes by studying customer blueprints and testing manufacturing methods, tooling, and equipment.
Work with Quality Engineering to detect, evaluate, and eliminate quality issues, reducing the cost of manufacturing for the company.
Estimate manufacturing costs, determine time standards, and make recommendations for fixturing and process requirements.
Provide hands-on technical support and instruction to manufacturing personnel on new machining procedures and processes.
Coordinate and facilitate continuous improvement/kaizen events, increasing participation among staff in cost improvement programs.
Act as liaison with customers, vendors, and staff to answer inquires, concerns, or complaints about outgoing product.
What We Are Looking For
Bachelor’s Degree (B.S.) in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or related field from a four-year college or university preferred
Minimum of 3 years related experience in a manufacturing environment
Strong knowledge of GD&T & Datum Structure Review
Experience with Solidworks & Mastercam is highly preferred
Deep understanding in a manufacturing environment with a mechanical background
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Why Northeast Tool?
Competitive pay
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
Company Matched 401K (Roth and Traditional)
Challenging and rewarding career
Family, team-focused working environment
We believe the only way our company can grow is when we nurture the growth of our employees. We are committed to working hard, having fun, and making an impact in our community. Sound too good to be true? Apply today to join our team.
